Timeline:
Early 2030's: extremely advanced gen AI swoops society, polluting the internet and letting democratic backsliding accelerate as a result. By this point, trump has plenary authority over US, and starmerite policy becomes standard, and Putin's russia is overthrown by an internal "democratic" coup. 
Mid 2042: israel and iran completely annihilate eachother in nuclear fire (to simplify).    
2050's: AGI boom happens (2048). Russia has been trying to get its hands on Europe for a while now with some success, but technological superiority lets them steamroll over their enemies. Russia is also renamed to Omnislavia (2050), and by the time the progress stops, they conquer pretty much the entire eastern and southern europe (minus turkey). Slightly before this point, EU is reorganized into European Federation (2046). Democratic backsliding at this point made functioning democracies nonexistent.  
2058: The Summer of Suffering happens where a billionaire creates an autonomous robot hive mind to cleanse North America of all human life. It works as planned and the entire NA becomes home to the Iron Fist, a nation exclusively populated by robots of various degree of sentience, with all human survivors fleeing to Eurasia. A global coalition to take back the continent is annihilated within minutes due to Iron Fist intel gathering being unreasonably good. Fear of AI slows down technological advancement to a more reasonable level. 
2070s: The Iron Fist force a treaty on humanity prohibiting development and use of nuclear weapons globally with severe consequences for violation after an artificial virus of plague inc tier strength (Corflaids) goes out of controlbut gets defeated  
2090's: present day of the books

The future russia is has been experimenting with human cloning and manufacturing secretly for a while, and after success, they create several prototype children with superpowers, with the main kid having telekinesis. He is grown in a lab environment and is provided with a mom and a dad who are secretly dead people resurrected as robots, and a class of other manufactured humans to provide him with a healthy social environment. Story starts with the main character being 7 years old, with him having ability to detect nearby people (not his parents).

S1E1: The Good, The Bad and The Panther

\*sara rosa julia\*

Larry, Bill and Paul
Kate, Julia, Tina, Rosa, Vici

It was March 13th, 2090. Another dead-silent night passed over an experimental, military-owned collective nurturing environment in the remote proximity of Tashkent, more commonly referred to as \*the lab\*. It consisted of many buildings, each serving as apartments for a single class of similarly-aged children and their assigned caretakers and jack-of-all-trades teacher. Each of them also included the classroom which also served as a detention room and a few other functions, the restrooms, the staff room, the everything - all packed into a single two-story building neatly. Each building, combined with the playground, the gym and everything else children needed outside after classes was referred to as a \*block\*, and each block was separated from others with roads, mimicking standard 4-lane roads from the cities in most aspects, except for being made out of painted concrete for durability and cost efficiency.

Hey, no snoring. Trying to establish the fucking setting here. Fine, here you go: the purpose of the lab was to nurture Starbloods into warriors, which were \*special\* bioengineered children who gained special powers throughout their life. The Starshards, which was what all children within the lab were formally and informally called, Starblood and otherwise, were also enabled and even pushed to fight eachother outside of classes, as long as they didn't kill anyone or cause any permanent damage, and blocks constantly went to wars against one another… What, am I going too fast now? Make up your mind already.

Fine, let's get to the point. This is the story about the most powerful Starblood in the lab, whose powers were absolutely devastating, who was feared by most and respected by the rest… Huh? Are you saying that's not a good setup for a shōnen-inspired story? I promise you, it's… You know what, fine. I'll give you a story about a Starblood with actual room for growth.

Adrian woke up in the morning, as he did every single day throughout his life. He didn't have much in life, but a tiny, yet fully functional room of his own was something he \*was\* entitled to, just like everyone in the lab. It had a bed, a table, a chair, shelves, a wardrobe and even a big window to allow the ruthless bright sun to wake him up early, since he couldn't afford the proper curtains. He was a white 10 year old boy of the most human-average face constitution, and his hair was black and medium-short. \*fix this description by writing it better, it sucks\* His arms were also quite muscular, which was unsurprisingly very common for Starshards, even for girls. He, along with many of his blockmates, learnt early on that being bruised by girls didn't hurt any less than being bruised by boys. By this point, it didn't hurt worse anymore, either.

Adrian put on his heat-protective cream, so as to not get fried by the scorching permasummer of the region of Uzbekistan, and dressed up in a standard dark-green t-shirt and brown shorts, fit for both classroom and the school breaks. The shorts had a modest sheath attached for his wooden sword: martial artists were rare in the lab, and he wasn't one of them. He brushed his teeth, rinsed his mouth, and went to the kitchen to eat with 3 of his brothers: Larry, Bill and Paul. Biologically speaking, they weren't brothers at all, and they didn't interact much with him. For example, now they were laughing and talking about beating the shit out of someone and something involving Johnsons (Adrian didn't know a single Johnson). Still, they shared the apartment and caretakers with Adrian, and so by the local definition of a sibling, they counted as brothers.

After finishing his sweetened but otherwise perfectly plain cereal along with green tea, he left his apartment along with his brothers to move out to the classroom and take a seat on the front rows. There were supplies and equipment for all kinds of lessons and general entertainment in drawers, some extra empty space, the smartboard behind the teacher's desk - everything needed to get such a multi-purpose room to work, and it mostly \*did\* work.

The rest of his block was slowly assembling too: Nathan, a Starblood in a red t-shirt and the block leader, his obnoxious girlfriend Lisa, the creepy blonde girl that nobody dared approach in a light-blue white-dotted dress covered to the brim with pockets, the guy who tried to fight with a sword in his mouth like in some Chinese cartoon called Haizei Wang and failed miserably, all other classmates whose names Adrian didn't care to remember… and some new boy with long, black hair, who looked way too tall to be in this block, who sat right behind him. His face also stood out by being much rougher than normal, and he was wearing a black t-shirt with a flak vest drawn on it.

"Who do you think you are to take my seat? Get your own!" - Adrian heard some girl from his block scold the new guy. "Hey, hey, hey, if you really want the seat, you could've asked!" - he heard her taking a few steps backwards. "Jeez. It's like you transferred here from Apathy Creek, Weirdo Street." - she said angrily before being heard walking away. Adrian didn't care to look backwards to see what was going on and kept balancing a pen on his right thumb to pass the time. Given that phones didn't let you do anything other than open the learning material during classes, he had to take what he could get.

After the first class finally started, the teacher, Mr. Mothersword, which was clearly not his actual second name, raised his hand to shut the class up and began:

"Morning, children. Before we begin, I wanted to introduce you to a new student transferring to this block. Bezdon, can you please step forward and introduce yourself?" - he was a man in his 50's with short hair, glasses, a jacket which made him look like a middle school student who was overprepared for middle school by his momma, and a stinky breath he was really insecure and self-conscious about.

Bezdon stepped forward in front of everyone's view, followed by insincere and even sarcastic claps. Everyone looked bored, except the new kid, who kept staring somewhere in Adrian's direction with a slight smile. "Yo." - he said in a somewhat deep voice in a carefree tone.

"That's it?" - an awkward silence dawned before being interrupted by whispers from the back of the bus after the teacher's question. Adrian heard stories on LabSocial about how awful other teachers were, and Mr. Mothersword wasn't nearly as unnecessarily strict, abrasive or power-drunk as some others. Not that he was perfect, or well-liked. "That's okay. Kids, this is one of the lab's most powerful Starbloods. He's on track to become one of the Motherland's best defenders. I want you all to show him due respect." - Mr. Mothersword reaffirmed what Adrian was already 99% sure of. Changing your name from the one assigned at birth required an entire thousand tokens, the local currency of Starshards, and earning and not losing a sum this huge in the lab wasn't something Adrian thought was even possible.

The rest of the class audibly expressed their confusion at what the teacher said. "What?/Huh?/Why?" - several people asked. "We already have too much Starbloods! Some blocks don't even have a single one. Why us? We don't want another one!" - Larry voiced what everyone else was thinking. "He's gonna bully us all into submission and ruin the streak! The streak, man!" - some other boy claimed for some reason.

The teacher raised his hand to shut everyone up again. "Now, now. Even though there were 3 Starbloods in this block before, one of you doesn't engage with the rest of the block, and one of you is, well, Adrian. So, we figured, why not put another, full-fledged Starblood into your ranks?" - he explained. He was right: of all the powers of ice, fire, hallucinogenesis and more, Adrian got the ability to detect nearby people in a pretty modest radius, and even then it didn't work on some people, mainly his parents. His step-parents told him that an emotionally rich, fulfilling or generally interesting life was essential for Starbloods discovering new abilities and ways to use them, but that didn't make any sense. Adrian may not have had any friends anymore, but he thought he lived a great life: playing really old games since the new ones weren't great, doing above average at school, going into battles and smacking his neighbors with a wooden sword, and it was clearly all interesting and fulfilling. Still, the disappointment at his own lack of growth loomed over him, and this was just another reminder that he could've been something greater.

The class still didn't accept the new arrival, but the teacher shut down their complaints as always and everyone went back to studying as usual. It wasn't that uncommon for the lab staff to force weird, stupid decisions like that, and it was a well-known phenomenon, according to LabSocial. Some assumed it to be social experiments, some thought it was a form of keeping the Starshards in line, but largely, nobody cared. That said, there was the term "Starspeck" formally designated for non-Starbloods, but using it around a Starshard was about as safe as eating a hornet's nest, even when used with no negative connotations, as the mechanics of "meaning over diction" or reclamation weren't known to 99% of the lab. The adults eventually had to stop using it, and it was a rare case where the Starshards' will could override that of their masters.

As Adrian was solving a long and stupid equation with an answer of 2 minus square root of 2, he felt something slithering around his left leg and then choking it. Upon looking down, grunting from the pressure, it was the doing of a smooth pitch black tentacle. "Why do \*I\* have to win the lottery again? There's 24 other perfect targets in the block. And it's during class, no less." - Adrian thought, taking a deep exasperated breath. Now he knew who the new arrival was exactly, and yep, he was indeed one of the strongest Starbloods. Possibly the strongest, since Adrian has never seen him lose any duels he was streamed partaking in. Starbloods didn't always have the flashiest possible powers, and they were sometimes manifested in unusual ways, like Bezdon's powerful dark tentacles. Adrian decided to sit back with his arms crossed and wait out the pain. The grasp kept gradually getting stronger before a second tentacle joined in, doubling the pain further. He laid on his arms, hyperventilating from overwhelming pain. \*make sure this doesn't sound sexual\*

"Is there a problem?" - the teacher looked at him and asked.

"He's hurting my leg and not-" - Adrian began answering in a severely strained voice before the tentacles let go of the legs and left him in peace. "-letting me concentrate." - he finished in his normal voice and gasped for air. "He stopped now." - he gasped for air again.

"He is clearly busy with his assignment. How could he possibly be hurting you?" - Adrian turned around to verify, and yep, he was indeed pretending to be busy writing something. Mr. Mothersword turned his head sideways somewhere. "I can hear you, Lisa. You're being loud." - he noted loudly.

"There were black tentacles grasping my legs. I can't focus when I'm in this much pain. Can I \*please\* get a different seat?" - Adrian asked, frustrated.

"Get back to work. You're not weaseling your way out of it." - he turned back towards the smartboard, where students were periodically called in to solve equations in order of when they were given in the digital textbooks, leaving Adrian's legs to be grabbed by Bezdon's tentacles not even a second after. It only took one \*honest\* mistake from 1.5 years ago, and from then on his worst intentions were always assumed and he could barely ever expect help from his teacher. "Victoria, could you explain what you're doing to the class, instead of just writing out the correct solution silently?" - Mr. Mothersword received no answer. "Hello? Like talking to a brick wall."

The tentacles continued harassing him throughout the class. Just when Adrian thought it was over, they began poking his legs instead. Sitting cross-legged on the chair without leaving the legs hanging made things even worse, as Bezdon just began poking his torso instead. Even though torsos were apparently more resilient than legs, the pain wasn't any less uncomfortable.

After the class was finally over, Adrian wasn't even done with a third of what he needed to do in class, meaning he had to do homework to make up for this. Homework in the lab was very scarce and situational, and having to do \*any at all\* always hurt. For school breaks, the children were always let outside and allowed to do whatever the 15 minutes they were given and the loose rules of the lab allowed. The surroundings of every block were outfitted with basic, difficult-to-damage gym and general practice equipment, magnetic lockers to store anything you needed, a playing field designed for various sports, the restroom, the sizable private room you could rent for tokens - everything needed to preoccupy the children on top of LabNet.

Instead of his usual exercise routine Adrian always did during the first break, he decided to go for a jog around the lab to give himself some rest from any potential bullying, which worked well for about 30 seconds before the numerous tentacles engulfed his body in full, lifted him up in the air and began choking him. Adrian was periodically given breathing windows, and he wasn't in danger of suffocating to death, but the windows were infrequent and insufficient, and the whole experience was still extremely painful.

"Please… Stop… Why…" - Adrian muttered. There was no response. "I have… tokens…" - the words fell on deaf ears. "Please… I

I'll take credit… If you stop…" - nothing happened, except for Adrian's energy being further exhausted by talking.

Over the course of the break, he heard noises of people gathering around the scene to observe and discuss the occurrence. Most were amused, the rest - shocked, not that Adrian could see anything other than the cloudy sky of his glorious homeland. Nobody tried to intervene - it wouldn't have ended well. When the loudspeakers invited the whole lab back to their classes, Adrian was quickly dropped face-upwards onto the ground from a small height, as if the last hour wasn't enough. He didn't have the energy to get up, but he could see Bezdon and his tentacles in full form for the first time as he was being rotated. He had 8 of them coming out from the top of his back, and as he was walking away along with everyone else, Adrian could see how they retracted back into his torso into 2 holes to the side of his spine. He had manually cut hatches for each tentacles' hole to streamline retracting into, similar to the flaps in assless chaps. The lower back had a highly detailed skull and bones symbol on them, taped in slightly off-center by accident.

Adrian hyperventilated for a while to collect the strength to get up and go to class, but his body refused to even roll around to the other side, let alone get up properly, and so he continued laying down, staring into the clouds and doing his best to not to cry as hard. To compensate for the volume of school being unintrusive, the consequences for trying to skip classes were the opposite, but at this point he was all out of gas. He was no stranger to bruises, knockouts, even beatdowns, which were even enjoyable sometimes, but this was way too much, and the worst part is, Adrian had no idea what did he do to deserve this. It looked like paid revenge, but what would that vengeance be for? When his blockmates asked him to help, he did so, little questions asked. He didn't beef with any other Starbloods. He contributed in battle plenty enough, and wasn't successful enough as a soldier that he gained any fame or infamy for it, either. The adults always made it clear \*they\* were responsible for punishing you and never used agent Starshards to enforce the order of the lab, with the word "order" being used loosely. So again, who?

After a few minutes, he saw his parents arrive

\*blah blah they give him some meds and get him back to class into a different seat, and they also fine him\*

The next class was about history. It was one of his least least favorite subjects (the double negative is intentional!), especially considering this particular lesson was about the Cold War, a fascinating 40-year period of the post-industrial era, and not "the history of how Ancient Egyptians invented clay". The entire world nearly being "fried by the cascade of gamma-rays" in the Cuban Missile Crisis was made even more fascinating to Adrian by the fact that neither Cuba nor America existed as countries in any form anymore, and that the USSR was ideologically reimagined twice since then.

He has successfully made it through the class without any other issues on top of being physically exhausted and mentally numbed and went outside. He knew what was happening earlier was only the beginning: he needed to endure more of that painful strangulation until Bezdon got bored, which could take anywhere from 10 more minutes to 10 more days, or could never even end at all. There was nothing left to do but to sit against a wall and mentally prepare for what's to come. Except when Adrian began approaching a spot where he wouldn't get scorched by the hellish Middle Asian sun, he heard Nathan tell Bezdon some distance away:

"Hey, new guy! You must think you're real tough." - he walked up in front of Bezdon and began staring at him. Despite being a functional Starblood, he still had a sheath with a wooden sword attached to his belt.

"Continue." - Bezdon grinned at him, not showing any signs of feeling threatened. Right after exiting the block building, he unsheathed his tentacles and began holding them to the side of his body like a pair of demonic wings, except the tentacles were pointing at Nathan. They made the size difference between the two feel even more exaggerated.

"What, you're new in the lab in general, or something? You don't see what I'm getting at?" - Nathan continued while a couple other blockmates of theirs noticed and started observing the exchange. Adrian also observed it, standing from a distance and covering his eyes with a hand.

"Pardon me, bro, I've got more brawn than brains, unfortunately. Could you spell it outloud for me, please?" - Bezdon requested in a carefree tone. He did his best to hide a smile.

"I am inviting you into a duel, for fuck's sake!"

"Oh, a duel, heard of those, sounds fun. Let's do this, noble Starblood. May our battle be legendary!" - everyone, not just Starbloods, loved to have cool speeches and stances to present to their opponents, but \*nobody\* made them this awkward and uninspired. It's like he actually was new in the lab: it was theoretically impossible to leave or enter the lab, but adults worked in truly mysterious ways, so who knows. "Need any prep time or wanna get to it?"

"I meant after school, with proper bets and audience and everything-"

"Are you scared of a little battle? Need half a day to prepare? Thought you were the proud block commander and not a cowardly wuss." - Bezdon taunted Nathan in a passive-aggressive tone.

"You're on, I'll make you eat those words!"

"That's the spirit! Come around the corner to the right so we don't get fried by the sun in 5 minutes and show me a good time." - Bezdon said gleefully and began walking away. He then coughed twice. "A good fight, I mean." - he said in a more neutral tone. As he walked by Adrian, he feinted a thrust at him from a different angle with each of the tentacles on his right side and walked away with a grin as Adrian stepped back and made a motion to block the would-be attacks with his right arm.

It seemed like there was a chance that Adrian wouldn't need to endure him any longer. Or that he'd get some breathing room for one school break. He relocated near a different wall to prepare to watch the fight when it finally happened and sat on the bench to watch the show. He knew the challenge wasn't about retribution or protection, since Adrian was mugged before by groups from other blocks and Nathan did nothing. It was more of a standard, melodramatic dick-measuring contest some Starbloods engaged in from time to time. They were fun to watch, and were one of the lab's favorite sources of entertainment, and this was one time Adrian got to visit one of those in person and not on a livestream.

After only around 3 minutes of sitting on a bench by the road and watching Bezdon stand on a white line of said road and browsing something in his phone, Nathan finally arrived at the scene, 1.5 adult alligators (5.25m) away from the opponent, plastic full helm on his head. Starblood or not, protecting your weak points wasn't something Starshards tended to ignore. By this point more than half the block had gathered around to watch, some with phones out to capture the footage, some to hang out on social media in general.

"I knew you didn't \*really\* need much time to prepare. A real Starblood could go to war anywhere, at any time, in underwear if they so please." - Bezdon spoke with the same glee as earlier, still doing something on his phone, or at least pretending. Starbloods weren't usually this calm about dueling, although the giant 4 pairs of tentacles to the sides of his body might have been a good justification for the exception.

"Shut up and put away the phone before I kick your ass." - Nathan assumed a combat stance with slightly bent knees and readied 2 small fireballs in each hand in front of his chest. It was customary for Starbloods to name their abilities, and Nathan's was named Scorching Infernal Fireball. 

Bezdon turned off his phone's screen and began rapidly, unevenly tapping against it with his thumbs. Yes, in that order. "Wait, hold up a second, need to finish something…"

After waiting for 15 seconds with an increasingly bored and frustrated face, Nathan finally couldn't wait any longer and threw the Scorching Infernal Fireballs he's been holding at the opponent in an arc, which expanded in radius by 2 times by this point, and Bezdon finally pretended to press the button to turn off the screen and put the phone away. At the same time, instead of dodging the fireballs or doing any other reasonable move, he poked each of them with one of his tentacles like balloons, reducing them into disproportionately small amounts of smoke, cinder and sparks flying sideways. These fireballs didn't look like much now, but they could inflict some pretty painful burns if they landed on someone's skin or clothes. 
Nathan began launching more of them with faster velocity, but they popped just like the rest. After watching everything with a blank expression for a bit, Bezdon rolled his eyes, made a performative yawn and pulled out his phone to pretend to type something again, which caused Nathan to hurl fireballs at higher fire rate. 
"Ah, thank god for my Inner Child. It's always everyone bothering me at the start of battles, why couldn't they just send me all these messages after them?" - Bezdon said with a smile ruining the line's initially apparent sincerity. And that's when Adrian recognized who Bezdon was: he shared a handle with the name of his Starblood power which he just dropped. Oh boy. 
The fireballs soon got way too small to pop, but Bezdon adapted by blocking them with the sides of his tentacles instead of popping them with the tips. At one point he even let one pass through to catch it with his left palm and licked off the cinder. Adrian couldn't tell if it hurt him at all.

Finally, realizing Bezdon was perfectly defended against the fireballs, Nathan pulled out his sword and charged at him in a well-practiced zigzag line. Bezdon pretended not to react, and when his opponent finally came close, he smacked Nathan with 2 of his right tentacles in the right shoulder, instantly knocking him to the ground to fall on his other shoulder. Some Starshards in the small crowd surrounding the battle cheered, mainly girls and troopers from the neighboring blocks. As he was recovering from the fall, Bezdon used all 8 of his tentacles to grab Nathan and lift him up in the air, leaving only the legs and head with the helm exposed, similar to how Adrian was grabbed earlier. Bezdon's slowly expanding shit-eating grin changed to a loud, maniacal cackle. "Oh, you really thought you had a chance! 'Ima eat those words', so how'd you like em? Did they pierce your soul with despair and hopelessness and fill you with rage at your own incompetence?" - he jeered euphorically, savouring the moment. 
"The Cube of Redundancy strikes again." - someone commented from the spectators, mocking the amazing super duper cool name of the power that Nathan was proud of and refused to ditch. 
"You know, you could've had a nice and peaceful day of punching pillows or dueling wet napkins, and I could've been minding \*my\* own business, but your foolhardiness was never gonna allow any of that!" - Bezdon cackled more and started walking around the scene aimlessly as everyone watched in silence.

"In retrospect, this couldn't have ended any other way. I guess I was hoping for a miracle..." - Adrian thought. This was also the first time he's seen a Starblood go through such extreme lengths to humiliate an opponent.

"Come on, keep trying to break free from the tenties. You can do it! I believe in you, man! \*Boy\*, I fought some pitifully weak Starbloods before, but ho-ho, you're actually pathetic. I knew you couldn't have been as good as a certain other Starblood in your block, but you haven't met even my lowest expectations! How did your block not overthrow you in all this time? There's some 8 year olds right down the road you can practice on, if-" - a girl from Adrian's block walked behind Bezdon and shot him in the back of the head from half an alligator (3.5m) away 3 times with a pneumatic pistol. She held it entirely in her right hand, since pneumatic pistols didn't have much in terms of recoil. Adrian didn't even know Starshards could get one of those.

Bezdon fell on the ground, his fall cushioned by the tentacles holding Nathan. Several people gasped and watched in shock. "Ah! Aaaaaaah-ow…" - he said as he fell on the ground. The tentacles retracted back into Bezdon's body on their own after another couple of seconds, and both duelists ended up lying on the ground, one grunting from pain, the other completely silent, lying face downwards. The girl then held the pistol upwards and blew off the smoke. There was no smoke.

"That escalated quickly." - Adrian commented outloud in moderate shock, even if his voice didn't reflect it. All of this was completely unprecedented.

She was wearing a white buttoned shirt with a faint light-blue grid and a reddish-brown rhombus-shaped cloth sewn to the top, visually resembling a small poncho, half-length jeans, a light-brown plastic helmet with a brim like on a cowboy hat and an open front despite the sides and back covered all the way down to the neck, and a determined frown. Her black hair was faintly visible above the forehead. The cloth went against the whole point of a buttoned shirt, but one button above the cloth remained so as to not kill the practicality with fashion completely. "Maybe \*you\* can practice on 8 year olds. With not being a sick, sadistic fuck! You come to a block of 10 year olds despite nearly being old enough to join the frontlines, abuse your powers, who the fuck do you think you are?" - she asked angrily. The "old enough to join the frontlines" was a hyperbole: Bezdon didn't look even remotely close to being 16.

"Kate, I think he's dead." - some other girl in the crowd said.

"What? Oh, fuck!" - Kate stepped back and covered her mouth with the left hand and lifted her right hand down. "Can someone check his heartbeat or something? In case he's playing dead." - she said quickly and anxiously.

Nobody moved or said anything until Nathan finally got up and joined the spectators. "Thanks." - he said as he walked away.

"Do me a favor and don't feel entitled to me saving your face next time." - Kate requested with mild disdain, fear or anxiety still seeping through her words, it wasn't clear what exactly. Might have been both.

People started slowly going back to their usual activities one by one. After another tense couple of seconds, she stepped forward to check on Bezdon at the same time as Adrian, pistol aimed at Bezdon. "I got this, I'm ready for the next round if it's coming." - he said.

Victoria continues to block the projectiles like nothing happened, until a fireball hits her in the cheek and deals no damage. Nathan and Lumi pause shooting at her for a moment in shock.

"She's so right, we're fucked." - whispers Lumina.

Nathan starts shooting a lot more fireballs. Victoria shrinks her ice shield on the side of Nathan back into a ball of ice and blocks every fireball with the top of her bare hands.

"You really need to sit next to Adrian over there, Mr. Overcompensation."

Nathan gets pissed. He starts casting a bigger fireball, Victoria turns the ball in her hand on Nathan's side into a small buckler. Nathan's big fireball starts to get very big. Victoria starts walking towards Nathan and he releases the big fireball at her. Lumina starts shooting eye lasers again. Victoria blocks all the eye lasers with the shield in her Lumina side hand and at the same time she deflects the big fireball with her small buckler, shattering both the buckler and the fireball and staggering Victoria for a moment. Right after she recovers, she launches the shattering ice ball at Nathan. He protects his eyes with his left arm, but gets staggered. At the same time Lumina activates her lightsaber, then her super speed and starts dashing erratically before launching a thrust at Victoria, which she ducks at the last moment, causing Lumina to trip and fall to the ground. Victoria throws her shield and shatters it mid air like she did with ice balls, but this time at Lumina, and steps away from both Nathan and Lumi. As this all was happening, Nathan was casting another fireball, this time less large yet still larger than his initial ones, and then he launches the fireball at Victoria's knees. This time, she tries kicking it with her shoes to reflect it back at Nathan and Lumina, which partially works, causing the fireball to break apart, with its pieces covering Lumina lying on the ground.

"Still think you two are hot shit?"

They both start rapidfiring projectiles at her and Lumina starts slowly getting up. At the same time, Victoria uses 2 ice balls to create a really large shield to block all the projectiles, then pulls out another ice ball from her pockets and throws it like a grenade at Lumina as she is halfway through standing up, which causes her to fall down again and start groaning in pain. Nathan notices this and tries to turn around and start sprinting away, to which Victoria starts sprinting at him, launches her big shield at him and shatters it midair into pieces, causing Nathan to fall facedown into the ground. As he tries to stand up, she presses him back to the ground with her cold hand, pulls out yet another ice ball out of her pockets, shatters it within her right hand, and pours the ice dust behind his shirt, causing him to scream from pain.

"You have better chances of succeeding in literally anything by yourself than your chances of defeating me."

"Okay,okay, stop, it hurts!"

She gets the ice dust off from his skin and brushes it to the side, then returns to holding his shoulder to prevent him from standing up.

"Let's make one thing clear. From this day on, I am the real leader of the block. Me. You will still handle all the day to day duties and be the public face and everything, but both you and all of our class will obey my command if I demand you to. Got it?"

"Got it, we have a deal."

Victoria silently stands up and walks away.

Camera shows block 80 where girls keep chasing boys and beating the shit out of them. When one of them pushes one of the girls back, someone snaps it with their phone and calls the local teacher, and the boy gets grabbed and dragged inside.

Back to block 85, Kate walks to Lumina. As Adrian starts coming close, he notices Victoria walking within shattering ice ball range from him and gets startled.

"You're not worth the ice. Keep going and admiring my work", she said filled with pride and sass.

Kate gets on her knees to talk to fallen Lumina.

"You alright? I've never seen anyone actually get hit by the epicenter of an ice ball grenade explosion."

"Ughhhh… I've had worse. Well, barely. "

"This is Adrian from block B0085. We got Lumina from block B0083 grievously injured and unable to move." He sits down, puts away his phone and starts petting her. "You fought well, babe. "

"Not… really. But thanks. Love."

Cut to the next day, in class.

"We have received a record number of injured children yesterday. Turns out, reports of Lumina from block B0083 were absolutely correct and a lot of girls all over the lab were plotting to beat the shit out of every boy they see to extract concessions from them. It was a clear exploitation of our laws protecting women, which we have fixed overnight by declaring it legal to attack a girl in self defence, while still keeping it illegal to attack girls without a casus beli. All the boys punished for breaking the old rule were pardoned. While we couldn't punish all the girls who abused the old rules, you should be ashamed of yourselves. "

Most boys in class are shown to have a lot of bruises and bandaids. "Also, Victoria, you're a bitch for extorting the entire class for a ton of tokens."

"Sorry, Mr. Teacher, but I can't hear you behind my massive goddamn paycheck. What was that again?"

S1E8 Day Off

Lumina, Kate and Adrian are laughing together while sitting in Adrian's room.

"So how did he like being presented with a box wrapped with a pretty bow that had a mountain of poo inside?" - asked Kate.

"Well, he got pissed off and it started a war that lasted about a week."

"Why doesn't that surprise me one bit?" - said Lumina.

"Huh, I wonder why? " - he answered in a goofy accent. Everyone laughed.

"Have I ever told you the story of how the two of us met?" - asks Lumina.

"Nope. Continue."

"Well, me and a deadbeat former friend of mine Jason were having just a casual sunday evening around 1.5 years ago… "

Cut to younger Jason and Lumina sitting at a desk inside one of their rooms, looking at the map of the lab, planning how they would acquire several hundreds of kilograms of any metal.

"These guys have bats made of tin. It would be easy to challenge them to a battle and steal all their weapons as loot. " - says Lumi.

"Yea, that should put us one step closer to our target. Don't you think our statue of a giant dookie will be a legendary relic for centuries to come?"

"Oh how I love thinking about it."

Jason gets a new message and reads it. "Huh. Some kid is starting a new religion that wants to bring peace to the whole world. "

"Jesus, I am about to die of cringe. How dumb are people?"

"Now, now, Lumi, don't be so prejudiced. You know the history of how the church of the spaghetti monster was initially thought to be a joke?"

"Yea, and then the monster got genetically engineered to be a real creature and now a sizable minority of sentient robots that overtook North America worship it as a deity. You're right, what if these loons are actually right. "

A few days later, the block 83 army is marching somewhere, until they encounter another, smaller group of people marching somewhere, dressed in funny clothes.

"Who the fuck are you weirdoes?" - asks them Lumina.

"Lumi, that's not a very charismatic greeting to a new faction, we don't wanna get on their bad side. Anyway, gentlemen, what are the plans for the evening?" - says Jason.

"We are the Army of Peace. We march around and we aim to bring peace to the lab by punishing anyone who violates the lab's serenity. "

"Are you melvins actually for real? You know that ever since the lab was open for us, everyone was at war with everyone else?"

"Very observant, good sir, and we're trying to solve that. For it is unwise for children of our ages to fight eachother and get scars instead of doing more normal things like learning new skills or playing games. So where are you heading?"

"We're marching on a certain block with the intention of defeating them with our superior might! We won't tell you why. "

"We want their metal! "

"Damn it, Kevin, will you ever learn when it's an appropriate place to speak?"

"Very well. We'll be going on our way. Enjoy the silly childish wars, while you still can."

Lumina sprints out in front and blasts an eye laser at the head of the guy who said that. "Stop annoying us and get outta here! We're tired of listening to your zealot bullshit!"

Jason gently grabs her by the shoulders. "Careful, I don't know if we want to take our chances pissing them off. They could be a part of a greater faction."

Cut to the actual battle for the metal. It went smoothly, thanks to Lumina's eye lasers and Jason's ability to pull the body of a blooded creature in any direction, rendering them nearly unable to do anything.

In the evening, Lumina asks her dad, "Dad, have you heard of the Army of Peace that aims to bring peace to the lab by bullying any interblock warfare? Can they even do that?"

"I haven't heard of them, darling. However, it sounds like they're not breaking any rules of juvenile warfare."

"Ugh. I really hope they won't get horribly strong or anything. "

The next day, the army of the block 83 suddenly severely decreased in numbers.

"Why is there less of us all of a sudden?" - asks Jason.

"Well I know Arthur has joined the army of piece last evening. "

"That bastard! Thank you, soldier." - says Lumina.

"It seems like we are facing a crisis that could end our way of life as we know it. You are hereby ordered to look through nearby blocks to see if there is anyone else who resists the Army of Peace. We will triumph over their bodies!" Claps are heard.

"And that's when we found eachother! I was also looking for allies in the fight against the boring cringelords." - says present day Kate.

Cut to Lumina returning from her diplomatic trip around the lab to find a new tough looking girl named Kate sitting on a bench. They approach eachother.

"Can I help you?"

"Sister, I would like to ask you the same question. I heard you pissed off the Army of Peace big time and I know a way how we can work together to return the orderly discord to the lab."

"Oh yea? Let's get to the side a little so we can talk in private. "

Cut to them standing away from people and talking.

"So basically, we have a massive part of our class not believing it's a big deal, with some even going further as to join the enemy. However, our leader is on board and in theory we could join forces to have your block do a pretend invasion on ours. We will pretend like we're fighting to lure out the Army of Peace, and then we both stop pretend fighting and attack the army, then we find where their leader is and kick his ass together. What do you think?"

"Wow, it's perfect! Give me the name of your class leader and I'll dm him and discuss this plan. "

They fistbump.

"Oh that's what happened. Damn, good cooking, Kate." - says present day Adrian.

She gives him a thumbs up.

"Wait, hold on, why don't you know that whole ordeal went? Unless…" - asks Lumi.

"Yea, I am afraid I was in the Army of Peace."

"But why would you join in on that? Don't you love fighting or watching people fight? You have powers, dude. One day they'll activate and you'll become just like me or Jason. "

"Yea, I know. I just felt disillusioned with everything and everyone at the time and I wanted something to change. But that whole situation has taught me to just shut up and roll with it."

"Adrian, while I would normally disagree with you that you should do nothing while the world around you burns, joining these losers was absolutely a mistake. Not because they lost, but because fighting is all we know and if you won, we would either feel chained to be unable to vent out our frustrations in life on others or the adults would come in and stop you because they want us to fight all our childhoods so by the time we reach the battlefield we'd know where's up or down. " - said Kate.

"Yea. Anyway, where were we?"

Cut to the actual plan going into motion. The two blocks are having a fake fight for a few tens of minutes, until the Army of Peace arrives and starts assaulting the attackers. A horn is heard, and block 85 goes to the sides of the Army and starts attacking them aswell. The Army of Peace ended up way stronger than initially thought to be: the allied forces were about 1.5 times the strength of a united block, the Army was stronger than that by a third. However, thanks to the element of surprise and a superior number of kids with powers for the allies, the Army has been defeated. It didn't take too long for the defeated kids to squeal about the location of the Army base. As it turned out, the leader was just a powerless kid, who got quickly coerced by Kate and Lumina into disbanding the Army.

"Wow, awesome!" - said present day Adrian.

"It was, and we were sometimes hanging together when my other friends got too lame."

"Aww." - said Kate.

"Now that I think about it. What exactly went wrong in your second round against Victoria?"

"Adrian, why…" - says Kate.

"Ugh. Fine, let me explain. You know how she has this nasty shattering ice ball attack which deals devastating damage at close range?"

"Yep."

"Neither of us could approach her. We didn't have the defensive capabilities to withstand her ice shards, so we kept trying to jam her between us, and I got the idea to synchronize my shots with Nathan's. And then he finally casted a fireball strong enough to break her guard. She could have dodged it, but A) it could hit me, and B) she's an annoying cocky bitch that likes to flex on people. But she didn't, and when it turned out to be slightly stronger than she thought, I thought that was a good enough opening to close the distance with my super speed dashes. However, when using that ability, my mind doesn't actually become faster, only my body does, and I have to plan my movements ahead to succeed. She must have expected an attack and dodged it. However, stupidly enough, I was putting my all into it, and when it missed, I was knocked to the ground because I didn't expect that outcome. From there I was very vulnerable to her counterattack, and fucking Nathan casted a fireball which she somehow managed to reflect with only her feet, and at that point the battle was already over. He wouldn't have stood a chance without me."

"Damn. I wonder if you could have won if you worn some better armor. "

"I mean, where would I get the armor sufficient enough to withstand these ice shards? The standard clothes we have are synthetic and garbage as defense. Oh, but I know! We can make some plate armor from the metal scraps from the giant dookie project so I can-"

"Lumi, stop. Seriously, you're out of control." - Kate said worryingly.

"What?" - Lumi answered as if she was just insulted.

"It hasn't even been a week since Victoria absolutely destroyed both you and Nathan. "

"Like I said, my defense stemmed from just one mistake which won't happen again. If we get around 10 warriors with shields, Nathan and myself, we got her for sure." She's starting to sound angry.

"Lumi, you're obsessed. She'll probably find a way to defeat you that way aswell, she could defeat the entire lab on her own for all we know! Please, don't make your life all about kicking her ass, it's not worth it. "

"SHUT UP! I WILL KICK HER ASS EVEN IF THE PREPARATION WILL TAKE ME A CENTURY! DON'T TRY TO STOP ME, YOU FUCKING CUNT!"

Adrian moves back a little in shock. Kate is shocked too.

"What happened to you? You never yelled at me before. Seriously, your hyperfixation on Victoria is changing you. " She puts her hands on Lumi's shoulders.

"GET AWAY FROM ME! I WILL DO WHATEVER IT TAKES TO FINISH THE JOB! I am going to start working on my new armor set. Are you with me, Addie?"

Silence. Both girls stare at Adrian, and he alternates between staring at both of them. Eventually Lumina gets tired of waiting and says "WELL FUCK YOU TOO!".

"Wowza."

"Why did you have to bring up Victoria again? We agreed to not remind Lumi of her. "

"I was really curious. I didn't think she really is that volatile."

"Can't blame you. She really didn't used to be like this."

"I feel like even her psychic energy readings have changed. Like, they've gotten more aggressive."

"That word again, what are you talking about?"

"Well, you know how I have powers, right?"

"No. Wait, do I?"

"Either way. If I focus just a little, I can see weird little traces of living humans around me, with some exceptions. From what I've been told by my parents, these are psychic energy readings that my special brain is detecting."

"Wow, but also damn, that's gotta be the least useful power to have because we're not allowed to play at nighttime and we can take our stuff to our rooms where they're completely safe from any intruders."

"I know, right? There's also this weird aspect that I can't sense my parents' psychic energy readings. When I asked my parents about why, they told me they have some sort of cybernetic enhancements to prevent them from emitting any psychic energy. "

"Why would they need that? "

"No idea, I asked them the same question but they told me they can't answer it. Oh, I just remembered, I can actually use this power to tell if there's someone behind me, but, again, I can only do it if I am slightly focused on my surroundings, so when you approached me from behind that one time, I didn't notice you."

"Oh that makes sense! Well I guess your power does have an actual, if niche, use!"

"Yep, I suppose I do!"

Cut to Lumina working her ass off to make a suit of plate armor with her classmates. Eventually she is done, and she dons her shitty plate armor and a ptotective visor and starts walking to block 85 to challenge Victoria, and dms Kate and Adrian to come watch. When she approaches Victoria's corner, she yells "VICTORIA!"

"You fucking serious right now?"

Instead of an answer, Lumina blasts Victoria with her laser eyes. She blocks the laser eyes like usual with her ice shield, and approaches Lumina. After noticing her intentions, instead of backing away, Lumina activates her laser sword to prepare for close range combat and starts approaching Victoria in turn. She blasts her with a shattering ice ball, as anticipated, and the ice shards manage to penetrate some unprotected parts of Lumina's clothes, but most of them bounce off. She tries another 2 shattering ice ball blasts, which staggers Lumina a little, but overall she remains on her feet. Lumina dashes to the melee range and slashes at Victoria, who promptly deflects the attack by forming an ice shield while the swing is ongoing, leading Lumina to drop her lightsaber and almost lose her balance. Victoria then uses that opportunity to grab Lumina's face in her hands.

"I see you're stubborn and aren't so easily dissuaded by the burning sensation of my icy hands. Maybe this will make you finally leave me alone. Walk."

She grabs Lumina by the neck, and leads her to her to where Victoria spends all her school breaks. She then puts her against a wall and throws some ice dust inside her shirt to preveng her from moving, and pulls out a big bottle of water from underneath her bench. She grabs an ice ball from her pockets, puts it on the bench and starts pouring water onto the ball to gradually make it as big as possible. After that's done, she positions Lumina to sit against a wall with her knees bent over, and turns the ice ball into a giant ice bubble to imprison Lumina inside of. At this point Lumina is in way too much pain to be able to break free. Victoria sits down and starts chatting on her phone like nothing happened. When Adrian and Kate approach her and the ice bubble, she quickly pulls out an ice ball with her left hand and tells them "You want some too, dickfaces?"

A montage shows Lumina banging against the walls of the ice bubble for the rest of the day, eventually giving up, while Victoria keeps sitting in her phone and doing something without losing focus. Eventually everyone is ordered to go to their homes, so Victoria puts away her phone, and converts the ice bubble back into a giant ball of ice and puts it under her bench. As she is doing this, she tells Lumina, "If you didn't learn your lesson, next time your friends will share the jail with you. See you around", to which Lumina stands up and walks away. Adrian and Kate come to her and hug her.

"Lumi, you're back!"

"Holy shit, sweetie, are you okay?"

"That was the worst pain i've ever experienced in my life."

"It's okay, baby, we're here for you!"

"Yea, thanks for keeping me entertained all this time, you guys. I don't wanna think how horrible it would have been without your help."

"Soo, are you planning anything for the next battle?"

"The problem is, she said next time, you guys will be joining me too. Do you know what this means? It means I need to have the most perfect and infallible plan there is next time I try this out. " This visibly shocks Adrian and Kate starts pounding herself on the face with her fist.

S1E9 The Meltdown

Lumina and Adrian are standing outside and trying to have a conversation.

"But I have no idea what's gone into you! You barely show affection to me anymore, and all you seem to be caring about is vengeance on Victoria and it makes me highly upset. I've got enough problems from rainbow gas induced depression already, you know. "

"Don't you realize that I am trying to protect us all from her bullying? She is a monster and she feels entitled to do whatever she wants! Why can't you understand that with her around, we can't live a good life?"

"She will put me and Kate with you in an ice bubble after the next rematch! You know how horrible it was down there, it's honestly a miracle you didn't completely get turned into a popsickle! Are you really willing to risk my well-being to exact revenge on her when we can just avoid her?"

"We can't avoid her, she's a mercenary, all it takes is for someone to give her just a bit of tokens and she will curb stomp our asses into the ground yet again!"

"So we stay away from her and bribe her if she ever attacks us again, what's the big deal?"

"Jesus Christ, Adrian, how fucking worthless are you? Are you seriously gonna let her step all over yourself like that? Have some pride, you fucking worm!"

Adrian covers his face with hands. Kate comes around. "Hey guys. Why do you look like someone mentioned Victoria again and why does he have his face covered?"

"He just won't understand why revenge on Victoria is our top priority and how nothing else is more important than that!"

"Kate, please pull out your gun and empty a clip into my head. I don't wanna listen to her anymore. Please, spare me from this pain. I beg you." - said Adrian in a highly distressed voice.

"Addie, I will not. Also, holy fuck, what have you done to him, Lumi?"

She shrugs.

"Look, Addie, everything is gonna be okay. I think you need some silence to decompress. I'll check on you later."

"Alright, see you guys."

"Man, why does every relationship I witness always resorts to this?" - Kate starts pondering.

"I don't know. I will protect him no matter what, even if he doesn't want it."

"And you don't see anything wrong with that mentality?"

"No?"

"Alright, fuck this convo. The reason why I came here is because I've received messages about a certain class finding a way to exploit their local doctor to acquire itching powder, which was then mixed with water to create an itching liquid which has been used in warfare between blocks as a very effective chemical weapon. "

"Wow, cool! I wonder if it's just what I need to defeat Victoria. "

"God damn it, Lumi, not only your obsession with Victoria is highly unhealthy, but you're also derailing the conversation. We need to collect a flask of the itching liquid from them as evidence and report it to adults before this exploit gets out of control!"

"You know, we're handling crisis after crisis after crisis, and we have to convince people to go to war time and time again every time something happens."

"What are you saying?" - Kate asks, thinking Lumi is about to give up on providing justice to everyone.

"How about we organize a group that would enforce our local Geneva Convention and punish anyone who violates it, and simply just everyone who's deliberately trying to bring chaos to the lab like the rainbow gas guy?"

"That's amazing, Lumi! Let's do it!"

"Awesome. I am gonna get my classmates to join in and you can get Nathan to get your classmates to join in. "

"That sounds great! I can take lead of the whole organization, I've been doing this for years. "

"Oh come on, Kate, don't you think a kid with powers would do a better job rallying everyone behind them?"

"Lumi."

"What?"

"Are you planning to use the army to get back at Victoria?"

"No, of course not." - Lumi says, trying to sound casual.

"Promise me you won't abuse your power to get back at Victoria. I will not help you assemble another plan to get back at her."

"Alright, alright. I promise. " - she replied in a defeated tone.

"Then you can be in charge and I will help you getting started. Thanks for being reasonable for a change."

"Aw thanks- wait, what do you mean for a change?"

Cut to Kate approaching Nathan, who is practicing casting spells.

"Hey, Nathan, wanna hear something?"

"Yes, Kate?"

"Well. Me and Lumi are starting a new organization to officially enforce the regulations we've all agreed on during all these years."

"Is this about the itching liquid incident? Whats the problem with just organizing an army and kicking their ass?"

"Well, I feel like it'd help to make the process more streamlined, you know? "

"Look, I wouldn't mind helping you two, but here's the problem: Victoria will kick my ass if she finds out I went behind her back to agree to this. This whole thing is set up to get back at her, right? "

"No, actually, she promised me that it isn't."

"Well, there's another problem. Victoria values money above all, and she will almost certainly get in the conflict of interest with your organization. She values money, you value order. She will never approve of this."

"Damn it, you're right. Have a good day."

Kate starts going somewhere, but Adrian comes near her. "Hey, Kate, can we talk?"

"Of course, what's up? "

"It's Lumi. She's starting to become very painful to be around. She's completely consumed by the idea to make Victoria pay. I don't know what to do anymore."

"I think I managed to get her distracted with the idea to make an organization to uphold the agreed laws of warfare. Hopefully that should help."

"Jesus, why can't she just quit? She'll have her heart impaled by an ice spike and her undead body will continue fighting Victoria until the end of time. Fucking fuck. "

"She promised not to do anything of the sort."

"I wouldn't trust anything that monster has promised. "

"Adrian, she's your gf!"

"Well I am tired of being pushed around, okay!" He walks away, sits down and starts thinking.

"Kate doesn't want to help me, Lumi is completely out of control. What if the boys can help? "

He approaches a "brother" of his while he's sparring with someone.

"Hey, \*name\*, can you help me with something real quick? "

"Sure, no problem. Timeout, i need a break for a few minutes."

They sit down on a bench together.

"You know Lumina, right?"

"Yea, I do. Your gf is a hero apparently who saved this lab numerous times, yet i still have a very bad feeling about her. "

"Yea, well, so do I. She gets her ass kicked by Victoria again and again, and she just won't quit thinking about her, and now she's founding some sort of police unit where she will absolutely abuse her power and try another rematch, getting me and Kate trapped with her in an ice bubble. "

"Well, she's a girl, of course she's highly emotional, obsessive and manipulative."

"Not all of them are like that, you know. I have a friend who is neither of those things."

"Yea, sure. Anyway, my advice? Dump her. Be free from that succubus. "

"But how could I do that? I'd feel alone and i'd suffer if I did that. "

"Trust me, it'll be better that way."

A checklist in Adrian's head is shown, with lines "Kate, The Boys, Parents\*, with Kate and The Boys being checked.

Cut to Adrian sitting in his room with his parents.

"So that's pretty much everything that's happened. I was suggested to dump her, but I don't want to, I know there's some good in her."

"Oh, son, I know what this is about. She thinks she can control you, and evidently she sort of can. She wants to assert her authority over you." - says Dad.

"But she told me that defeating Victoria once and for all would be for mine and everyone's good! She cares about me, but she is fucking insane and completely lost in her obsession. "

"Just because she told you that doesn't mean she actually means it! Have you considered that she's not obsessed with protecting you, but instead obsessed, period? " - suggests Mom.

"But she was always nice to me."

"Look, son, you need to assert your authority over her. Tell her that you will not stand for her bullshit and set some boundaries, and threaten to leave her if she doesn't respect them. Or pay Victoria to kick her ass if she refuses to cooperate with you."

"Alright. Thanks, guys."

Cut to Adrian walking outside.

"Yea, as if a threat of leaving her is good leverage, she'll just go nuts and put me in a hospital." The checklist is shown, with Parents being checked this time. "Paying Victoria will only anger her for sure and put a further rift between us. Wait. Paying Victoria. What if she knows something? She's a wonderful speaker, she masterfully defeated me, Lumi and Nathan verbally when we were trying to convince our block not to assault block 80 to avoid the ambush by the girls." A new line called Victoria appears in the checklist.

Adrian looks at Victoria from afar. She is on her phone, as per usual. "It's okay, Addie, everything will be fine if you don't treat her as your worst enemy and choose your words carefully. Holy shit. Holy shit. " He finally decides to come close.

"What? Here to invite me into another trap?"

"Hi. Nope, just here to talk." - he says with audible fear in his voice.

"Okay. What's this about?"

Adrian takes a deep breath. "I have problems with Lumina, I think she lost her mind in her chase to exact revenge on you and she just refuses to treat me with affection and love anymore. I wanted to ask you if you knew how to make her less of a bitch, I mean you did masterfully cover up the girl rampage conspiracy that one time. "

"\*sigh\* For fuck's sake. I am not your therapist, or your parent. Scram."

"What if I transfer you 5 tokens?"

"Make it 10 and you get a few minutes. "

"Deal." He transfers her the tokens and shows that they've been transferred.

"Okay, sit down and tell me the full story."

"Alright. So,..."

Cut to the end of his explanation.

"...And everyone I talked to proposed me completely ridiculous suggestions like dumping her, setting boundaries and threatening her with a breakup or with paying you to kick her ass if she doesn't respect them. I want to know what would you do."

"I like the idea of paying me to kick her ass, why not go with that?"

Anxious pause. "Because it will certainly create a rift in our relationship and will make her highly distrust me."

"Hmm. Perhaps. Anyway, there's another option of what you could do. It's a basic manipulation tactic called a Cold Shoulder."

"Never heard of it, continue."

"You know how we girls plotted to give you boys hell to extract concessions from you? This is similar, however, instead of doing that, just ignore her and pay her no attention whatsoever. When she tells you anything at all, ignore her completely. Try not to avoid Kate too, because if Lumina sees you interacting with her like normal while completely ignoring her, it'll make her feel more excluded and will achieve better results. Of course, if just listening to her starts being painful in of itself, it's okay to get away from her. Keep doing that for a few days, a week if it's really bad, and use the threat of doing that again to extract a concession from her: a concession of respecting your boundaries. Take into account that overdoing it will make her feel like she's walking on eggshells which will be highly damaging to your relationship. "

"Wow. Thank you."

"You're welcome. I need to get back to it."

S2E1 The Train of Destiny

Adrian wakes up in the upper left bunk bed in a high speed train, clackling across the tracks somewhere. He and his group have been provided with a closed room inside the train with 2 double bunk beds and a table in the middle. As he looks outside, he sees beautiful trees of autumny, warm colors, growing beside the tracks. He looks down and sees Kate and Jason sitting on the bottom bed, whispering about something. There's a plastic dish with fried potatoes and synthetic meat, plus a plastic fork. Kate notices Adrian is awake.

"Hey, look who's awake!"

"You slept a whole 2 hours longer than I did! We can finally talk without whispering." - Jason commented.

"Morning, guys." - Adrian said, well rested.

"Come on, come down here. There's a spot on my bed as well as some food with your name on it. " - Vici suggested.

"You know, despite our material value and importance, you shouldn't vandalize government property by writing my name on your blanket with a marker, Vici. Someone sewn that thing, you know. "

"I will do whatever I want, smartass, now come the fuck down or next night you'll be sleeping on the table curled up like a shrimp." - she replied playfully.

"Okay, ma'am, simmer down. I don't want a free ice bracelet." - Adrian replied, smiling, dropped down from his bed to sit near Victoria and began eating.

Kate and Jason looked weird at her.

"Do you guys always interact like that?" - Kate asked after a delay.

"Depends on her mood." - Adrian replied, his mouth full.

"I am capable of playful banter too. Did you really think that just because I don't always talk much I am socially inept?" - Victoria asked.

"Whatever you say, miss Shattering Ice Maraca." - Kate japed.

"Dude, watch out, she's gonna shatter your face with an ice ball for that." - Jason said, causing Kate to laugh and Vici and Adrian to smile.

"You guys have some balls to say things like that to my face after we've been on speaking terms for this little. You're lucky I understand that this is your way of giving me affection." - Victoria replies.

"I still can't believe it's so beautiful on the outside. I've only ever seen this natural beauty from photos, which could be AI generated too for all I know." - Adrian comments.

"If you think about it, what you're seeing outside is actually highly disturbing. These trees are meant to be naked and covered in snow by the time it's the middle of December, but these trees have a warm color of autumn. "

"Well, that's confusing." - Jason notes.

"It's because our planet has been quickly turning into a boiling hellhole for a long time. Think about it, why did we never see a winter and our summers are hellish hot? Climate change. It's partially why we've decided to move to Murmansk, despite a huge chunk of it drowning underwater: there are actually still winters out there."

"That sounds awesome, I wonder how it would feel to build a snowman." - Kate comments.

"Doesn't sound very fun to live in an environment where your balls freeze off once a year, but at least the summers won't burn our skins off, right?" - Jason asks.

"You're right about that. I asked my dad if the government is doing anything about this problem and he told me that they're doing their best without providing me with any details." - Vici notes.

"I bet it was the robots of the Iron Fist fisting the rest of the world with their climate change with their evil technology. I mean, they don't care if they're hotter by a few degrees Celsius, it's us humans who have our skin boil every summer." - Adrian says, agitated.

"They might have, but we don't really know. Don't you guys find it weird that for the last, like, 60 years our Motherland was awesome and perfect and how everyone else was a complete dickhead? It's like the moment when Russia became democratic, everything became awesome and a new golden age started."

"While in reality, modern digital entertainment is such garbage. The games in particular are just complete junk and we have to mainly play games that should have been considered unplayable relics, yet are the best ones we got." - Jason comments.

"You're so right, have you guys played European Escalation II? Where the European Confederation invades the Motherland and you have to defend it?" - Adrian asks.

"I did, I have never played an easier and less balanced strategy game in my life. I don't know if it's AI generated or not, but it's so horrible that it may as well be."

"Or that one cop game where the police are portrayed as morally perfect servants of the law that fight crime, refuse bribes and whenever any cop does anything bad, they're quickly found out and jailed. The cops in Russia used to be corrupt and overall horrible, but now they're holy angels of justice for some reason?" - Victoria said.

"If the military did what they did to us before the Great Fuck You a few days ago, I can't imagine police being any better. "

"The Great Fuck You…" - Kate wheezed and everyone else smiled.

"Yea, it's also a great name. Though, I do prefer the original name: Swords of the Starbloods." - Victoria commented.

As they were troubling, the group did a lot of sleeping, talking, playing, laughing and watching the landscape outside the window. Vici was also making small sculptures out of ice she made from sink water. They weren't amazing, but everyone was impressed with them regardless.

Eventually, they arrived in Moscow to hop on a different high speed train that would take them straight to Murmansk. The children, their parents walked from the previous railway station to the one they needed on the opposite side of the road. Some of them were with suitcases, all of them in light coats and hats except Victoria. They look around and see an unholy amount of cops everywhere, food places packed to the limit with bright, flashy signs, an unholy mountain of billboards seen everywhere, yet at the same time, there's plenty of dirt and garbage everywhere, aswell as homeless men with overgrown facial hair and dirty clothes here and there. The streets are filled with tons of tiny cars with barely enough space for 2 passengers, all with ads on them. The kids all looked disgusted and overwhelmed.

"I refuse to believe this is a real place that exists on the planet Earth. " - Victoria comments, exasperated.

"Dude, it's like a pay to win mobile game, but as a city, and 10 times worse!" - Adrian comments.

"This is overwhelming and I hate it. I really hope it won't take long until we're back on the train." - Kate comments.

"Don't worry, sweetie, it won't take much more." - Kate's mom comforted them.

A random middle aged slightly overweight man in a blue cap with a sign that says, "Vote for Omnislavian Supremacy!" and depicts a proud Omnislavian soldier with an AK-74 and the Omnislavian flag, approaches the group.

"Hey, kids! If your parents vote for Omnislavian Supremacy, they will pay less taxes and there will be more money for them to spend on candy!" - He said cheerfully.

Victoria pulls out an ice maraca from her pocket, turns it into a sharp ice dagger and faces the stranger. "I am going to slit your throat, and then your wrists, then leave you lying on the ground until all your clothes are painted red and stare at you with pleasure as a puddle of blood surrounds your body until you slowly and painfully die from blood loss if you don't fuck off right now."

The stranger was horrified, and the rest of the kids were mildly shocked. "She's right, now fuck off and bother someone else." - Adrian's father said with a mildly threatening voice. The stranger just kept standing in place with an open mouth and not moving, and the group just went past him.

"You weren't actually going to do that to him, were you?" - Kate asks.

"As much joy it would have brought me to do that, I would like my first kill to be someone special. An enemy spy, a dangerous criminal, a drunken hobo who tries to kill me, anyone but a walking ad for a political party."

"I am sure he is just doing his job, just like other adults." - Jason said.

"Jason, look around. Do you really think this world needs any more ads?"

Tense silence. "I don't wanna think about this. Can we all just collectively agree that this city is a fucking nightmare?" - Adrian said with frustration.

"Yep/Absolutely/Let's get the fuck out of here as soon as we can." - Kate, Jason and Victoria all said at the same time.

After getting on a different high speed train to reside in an almost identical room, the group continue to do whatever they can to spend the time. Kate and Victoria are seen hanging out together and doing something while Adrian and Jason chat about something else and have fun.

At some point, Adrian and Jason are seen doing something on their phones in their respective beds and looking mildly bored.

"Man, why can't these phones just connect to the countrywide network?" - Jason asks.

"No idea. I was told something along the lines of the phones being hardcoded to be unable to do that so we're gonna need to make enough money to buy new phones." - Adrian replied.

"That's fucked."

The door opens and Kate and Victoria arrive in the room, then sit down on Vici's bed.

"Guys, guys! We've prepared something cool for you!" - Kate exclaims.

"Oh, is it what you two have been working on lately?" - Adrian asks and gets down on the ground level to sit next to Jason.

"I've been wondering what were the two of you doing all this time. Thought it was going to be some sort of a prank." - Jason commented.

"I am happy none of you caught on. Hit em, Katie." - Victoria said with mild anticipation. Kate began singing, full of emotion:

"Born to fight,

Spread the light,

It's really not that hard, I swear.

The ice shards are flying,

But my soul is dying,

I won't last much longer, I fear.

The adults command me "Destroy",

They tell me the reason when I ask why.

But if all I can do is kill

Where has it gone, my free will?

The world is on fire,

The situation is dire,

And I must save it, I'm afraid.

I charge into battle,

The bones start to rattle,

But my flames still fade away.

Show my might,

Slay the night,

Yet I feel my end is near.

The enemy's falling,

But my agony is growing,

And into the void I stare.

Darkness is rampant, consuming it all,

I train and I fight, or the country will fall.

They don't understand, I'm drowning in pain,

They don't give a fuck that I am going insane.

The people are crying,

Their children are dying,

And I must extinguish the flame.

No matter the season,

I fight for a reason,

Yet my fires die just the same."

Jason watched and listened with an opened mouth as Adrian sat back and just enjoyed the performance. After it was over, Jason started clapping, and Adrian joined him shortly after.

"You girls cooked, holy shit! That was deep!" - he said.

"That was beyond amazing! Wait, Vici, why did you just sit there and smile as Kate was singing?" - Jason commented.

"Dude, the only way it would have been more obvious that Vici was the one who wrote the lyrics would be if they charged us money before singing this to us." - Adrian jabbed. Kate and Jason laughed.

"I need to start charging you for each time you drop one of those." - Victoria replied playfully.

"Not before I start charging you for talking to me every day."

"Too far, Adrian. Try again."

"Sorry. Charge my… balls." - he responded awkwardly.

"Good enough."

"Now I am jealous Vici gets a theme song and none of us don't." - Jason comments.

"To make something like that, you need to have a clear direction in life and something that brings you great pain as inspiration. For example, I want to earn money any way I can, even if I have to kill a lot of people, while at the same time having more skills and passions than just bringing death, and my source of pain was being trapped in the lab with no way out. What's your angle?" - Victoria explains.

"I just wanna socialize and have real friends, not much else. It was so lonely in the big house, and even after I left, I felt like I was completely isolated from everyone other than Lumina, and even she betrayed me and just generally got worse in every way."

"Amen to that." - Adrian noted.

"Well, I doubt we could do a worse job of being friends than her, so, you're in luck!" - Kate commented.

"That's a mood, Jason. Adrian, what about you?" - Vici asked.

"Hm? Oh, I don't know, dude, I just wanna follow you wherever you go and generally have fun in life. My pain? Having a weird power that either makes me too powerful to participate or too weak to do anything, the worst of both worlds."

"I gotta admit, I do wish we could fight together more often. Maybe Murmansk has some way we can improve ourselves in that regard."

"Won't help the fact that what I got isn't much good for a song."

"We're just happy you're here anyway."

"Can I go? Can I go?" - Kate eagerly asked.

"Of course."

"My goal: justice! My pain: injustice!"

"Concise and powerful. Don't see why would you want to make the world a better place when it's clearly irreversibly fucked, but you do you." - Vici commented.

"It's not that fucked. And even if it is, I am ready to do my share of putting evil in its place until the day I die, and maybe one day, we will all live in a gentle world of happiness and joy."

"Cool!" - Adrian exclaims.

Eventually, the group arrives in Murmansk. The city outside the railway station looked like a clean small town environment, with a reasonable amount of commercial establishments. The streets were still filled with tiny electric cars and vans filled with an uncomfortable amount of ads on them, and there's a moderate amount of snow everywhere. It's afternoon outside.

"At least not all cities in Omnislavia are like Moscow." - Adrian says.

"Good pick, Vici." - Kate comments.

"Even the air here feels better." - Vici notices.

The group hops into 2 large parked vans, with the adults going into one of them and the kids going into the other, then they both hit the road.

After a while of traveling in silence, the children inside the van start to look bored. Adrian and Victoria are sitting on one side, holding hands, and Jason and Kate are sitting on the other.

"Can't wait for this to be over already." - Adrian says with audible dread.

"At least we can look outside and watch the buildings… Oh my god, guys, look outside." - Kate notices something.

As everyone looks outside, they see identical 10 story tall buildings standing everywhere, painted ugly orange and shitstain brown. They saw all the windows on upper floors blocked by dark metallic bars and several people on the streets walking somewhere. One woman was walking with giant holes on the right leg of her jeans and the right elbow of her dark green coat.

"I mean, if they only look shitty but are actually fine to live in…" - Victoria thinks aloud.

The van stopped at a red light. "Look at that woman in a thick green shirt, why do her clothes look like a dog tore chunks off them? Is she too poor to afford something in good condition?" - Adrian asks in surprise. Jason and Kate move to the other side to look at the mysterious woman.

"Historically speaking, there's a good chance these people just have a twisted idea of fashion." - Vici suggests.

"Or they're just proud of being poor, for some reason?" - Kate guesses.

"Maybe she's just too hot in these clothes and she made these holes herself so it's not as cold?" - Jason gives his guess.

"Jason, that makes no sense." - Adrian replies.

"I wouldn't be so quick to dismiss that, Adrian. These cities are weird and none of them make any sense. " - Victoria says.

"Still beats our throne of destruction back at the lab, mm?"

She sighs. "Anything would."

After going back home to wait until it's darker while watching a highly inaccurate sword fighting tutorial, unload their school backpacks and load each of them with a 5L bottles of the abovementioned liquid, then putting on their new brown and green raincoats, the definitely-not-heroes ventured back onto the streets of Murmansk. After taking a bus towards the target car, they missed their target by 2 bus stops due to being way too invested in watching a video explaining a conspiracy theory about the French being headless and had to wait for another bus to drive them where they were meant to exit, then another one for a transit, and walking around 1.7km to their actual destination which was somewhere in a specific apartment block, putting on 2 medical masks a few blocks away.

"Can't find any KQ's… Wait, did you say 'KQ' yourself?"
