They put down their backpacks, pulled out a bottle of a liquid with a weird name Adrian absolutely wouldn't be able to mentally register and proceeded to quickly but thoroughly coat the tires with it, pouring some on. Adrian lit up a couple of matches just to be safe and handed them over to Vici who embedded them into an ice stick and successfully lit up the car on fire in all key places. It took a few pairs of matches, but they eventually succeeded, put on their backpacks and hastily walked away without looking back, taking a path between the pavement and other cars to avoid detection.

"These kids are all focused on the car now. The tires popping were probably heard all the way from the lab. I don't think they're paying attention to us, thankfully, just the car. They went inside a random apartment block a decent distance away after walking in as someone was leaving, put away their masks and raincoats to throw off any potential security cameras or stalkers, then went home, texting Yulia's dad that they've successfully bought and gifted his ex-wife a toy firetruck along the way. The next day in school during the second break, Adrian and Vici were standing against a wall and watching a group of teenagers to their left talk about something. Adrian was projecting weird and/or loud sounds into their heads with big enough delays to confuse them and then losing it afterwards along with Victoria as his targets were getting confused and startled by their minds being violated. The range of Adrian's powers was good enough that there was no way in hell to get detected, or at least that's what they were hoping was the case. At some point, angry Yulia approached them:

"What the fuck did you do yesterday?"

"Exactly what we planned. I saw Linda being extremely sleep deprived and volatile today, so I assume we succeeded. Did we not?" - Vici asked, still recovering from laughter.

"It did, and it ruined the entire evening for her family as they watched Charlie die a slow and painful death! They tried their best to help, but he died. Why? Why are you such a monster?" - a tear was seen in her eye, but her voice didn't reflect crying.

"Whoa there. One question, was this a sting operation all along? Because you won't wanna know what we would do to your face if you don't pay us." - ice maracas appeared in Victoria's hands.

"I have the payment. I just want you to explain, why did you choose to kill her in the most agonizing way imaginable?" - by this point several people have begun watching them all converse. Linda or Fernanda were standing too far to hear or see anything.

"We got a hit on the dog, we've successfully pulled it off. Your goal was to hurt Linda, and she didn't look unharmed."

"I loved Charlie! I didn't want it to die like \*that\*!"

"Then you should have given better instructions. I am sure we would have found something which could have done the job instantaneously." - Victoria shrugged.

As she was finishing talking, someone from outside their class snuck up behind Yulia and pulled her shirt backwards and sprinted away as she was turning around and impulsively saying several swear words very loudly. Adrian did his best to contain the laughter, but only his volume has been successfully contained through covering his mouth. Vici couldn't help but to exhale, but overall kept her composure.

"Oh, you think this is funny? Using your mind control or a friend to interrupt our conversation? Ha ha fucking ha. Are you happy now?"

"It's not me, I swear." - he was still dying and it felt like the most obvious lie ever spoken, even if he never found out if Yulia believed it.

"I would recommend not tempting the wrath of Victoria by being passive aggressive to Adrian. Look, it's clear that you've made a mistake by not properly analyzing the ramifications of your actions. There's nothing more to talk about. Do you have the payment on you right now or are we going to have to burn your house to the ground?" - the switch from almost laughing at Adrian's silly prank to morbid seriousness was instant.

Instead of answering, Yulia pulled out a portable console from her backpack along with another envelope and walked away shortly after. Along with her, the small row of bystanders started quickly dispersing. Vici nodded at Adrian, and he began trying to open the envelope.

"No, not now, there's too many eyes around. I meant, can you put them into my backpack?"

Adrian smiled and complied. "Damn. I guess we just can't quite communicate telepathically yet."

"We're close enough. Maybe we could see if we could install something which would allow the two of us to telepathically communicate, that could be fun. Man, I can't believe how I reacted to her being rude to you. 'Tempt the wrath of Victoria'? Jesus, am I lame. I should really work on my threats." - she put away her ice maracas and resumed standing against a wall with Adrian.

"I heard nothing. I am more curious about why you threatened her this overtly about house burning. You wouldn't do that if you thought you could extract a contract or two from her, would you?"

"No, I wouldn't, that's another thing. I got so alarmed by her not thanking us for a job well done that I prioritized the payment over any future contracts. Fuck. She probably wouldn't have ever wanted to scam us, considering she knows it'd be suicide given her knowledge about all our powers and connections. What about the guy who snuck up on her? It was you, right?" - Vici sounded extremely frustrated.

"Yep. She was being very loud and I wanted her to shut up without saying it directly, so that was how I figured I could achieve it. He was a little confused by having his mind invaded, but I assured him that I am a friend and that I would reward him with a lot of money if he pulled her shirt backwards and then ran away when she got spooked. Did you see the look on her face?" - his eyes flashed with joy.

"I did. I loved it, masterful work. Just, please try to keep yourself together next time, even if I wasn't much better with my false positives. Well, no, at this point it's fair to say that I am entirely responsible for our failure, considering we could have easily saved it from your little prank if I properly reacted to the situation. We need to have better mental fortitude than this for us to succeed in life. But again, that was a priceless prank. Let's do more sometime."

"You're right. Also, look to the right. Are you seeing this shit?" - he noticed Yulia in the distance talking with the friends she claimed to have hated only a few days ago. Their combined body language reflected how mentally drained they all were.

"Mmm? Oh. That's fucked. I guess we've managed to repair a broken friendship so, yay us? If you can call it a friendship anymore."

"I just don't get this city. What is wrong with everyone."

"There's an upside in everything: it's easier for us to distance ourselves from these people. You'll see, your prickly subconsciousness would be a lot less unhappy about ruining these people and killing them, because they're weird and not okay in the head and not like us. The 'prickly' part came out so wrong, I am sorry."

In response, she got a hug. "Don't be. It's okay. On the bright side, we'll never have to talk to her again."

After school was over, they were having a conversation as they were approaching their home.

"I would be amazed if you manage to convince Kate to get on board with this. Jason, maybe, but Kate? You're gonna need some seriously goddamn amazing arguments for her to do something so out of character." - Adrian was thinking aloud.

"Oh, Adrian. I have ample experience in the field. Sure, it's harder when I can't lie or pressure or coerce or anything like that, she \*is\* one of us after all. But I've got ethical tools at my disposal too. You'll see." - she promised casually.

"I wonder what kind of black magic it will be this time."

"Don't know any black magic. Will probably need to visit the jail cells of a local police department to learn some, if they let us. Does that joke even work anymore?"

"Wait, what- Oooh." Adrian shrugged. "Logically, it shouldn't, considering we've been taught the values of all men being equal before the country and everything, but I don't think logic is something we can rely on in this city."

"Yea, no. What if every morning they spin a wheel for a negative trait to assign to each minority? 'Today Mexicans shall be known as thieves, Middle Asians as stoopid, and the Black as foreign spies'. Do you know anyone else I missed who I can declare as drug pushers or gangsters? Oh, hell." - her phone rang. The text which I marked with a single ' was pronounced in a very weird mix of a British and Eastern European accent. She picked up the phone and turned on the loudspeaker. "Ssup?"

"Hey, Vici. And Adrian, if he can hear me." - Kate said.

"Hi! Of course I can. You sound different. Is something wrong?" - he asked.

"It's just that I wanted to ask, was it you two who poisoned 5 dogs in an apartment block not far from where we live? I saw it on the news."

Adrian's eyes widened and he stopped in place along with Vici. "Five? Poison? No way. Did the news outlet mention the exact place where it happened?" - she asked with concern.

"It did, but I don't remember exactly. Something like Lincoln Street, 6?" - Adrian loudly and quickly inhaled and covered his mouth in shock. Victoria just made an awkward face and also stood silent for a long while trying to wrap her head around the situation. "You're both silent. Look, let's just talk this over and discuss what happened. It's not like it was intentional, right?"

Adrian sat on a rusty metal fence and started breathing deeply. "It wasn't. We were tasked with putting a ton of food trays around that area with the goal of forcing one of Yulia's former, or I guess present friends to stop and give her a window to sneak up behind the friend and beat the shit out of her." - Vici took a heavy breath. She figured she could spin the confrontation with Yulia from earlier as a performative breakup rather than a real one if Kate were to find out about it through rumors, and the genuine feeling of displeasure and frustration definitely helped. She also noticed Adrian being in stress and began comforting him with pets. "This is such a disaster. Who knew they're this fragile?"

"It's weird that you say it was a disaster. I know you wouldn't lie to me, but do you really think it is?"

"Better believe it, Kate. That was a terrible miscalculation. It's the equivalent of accidentally demolishing a school after being asked to beat up one single kid. Ugh, we should probably go clean up what's left before someone else dies."

"It's okay, sis. The neighbors could recognize you if they saw you putting down the food the day before. We all make mistakes, okay? I am just happy that you're mature enough to recognize that. And at least one of them survived." - Kate's tone became supportive again.

"Of course I am. We should probably head home. Take care and thanks for telling us."

"Have a good day! And don't beat yourself up over it."

"Can't promise that." - she hung up the call, doublechecked if she really did and began walking in circles with her hands on her temples like a stereotypical psychic. "Holy mother of shit, how didn't I know that was gonna happen? The target obviously wasn't the only dog in the area. This job went so far off the rails. Are you alright?" - Victoria stopped and faced Adrian.

"I'm good. I really hope you knew what you were doing with that alibi. There's just one thing I am confused about, how much of what you said was a lie?" - he stood up and they resumed walking. Adrian's tone of voice was residual with shock but his breathing mostly recovered.

"The part with cleaning up what's left was pure virtue signaling, and I made up our story, but I actually do feel bad about this. This isn't collateral damage anymore, it's collateral armageddon. Noone likes an assassin who leaves collateral damage. It's a good thing-"

He put his hand on her shoulder and looked at her. "Vici. Sweetie. Calm down. Look, I know it's weird for me to say this considering I've been hit with a panic attack just as I found out, and I am frankly still trying to process it, but Kate is right, we shouldn't beat ourselves up over it. It's obvious we've done something horrible, but it was also the first major crime we've ever committed. The planning didn't even take half an hour, and we're obviously still inexperienced when it comes to life in the outside world. But what I am trying to say is, we need to make mistakes to learn anything in life, and besides, the cards were clearly stacked against us, and we at least technically succeeded, even if the execution was beyond sloppy."

Victoria was alternating between looking to the opposite side and downwards. "It really is that obvious that I am blowing this out of proportion? That's probably not the right way to put it. But I am glad to have you to keep me in check. I hope I helped you with your little panic attack too. Wait, how long have we been standing in front of a door?" - she calmed down partially.

"Around 10 seconds. I thought you didn't want to interrupt your train of thought."

She unlocked the door inside the home apartment block and they went in. "No, I am just consumed by my feelings. I am not used to this mental state, it's like this city is changing me. Or you are, one of the two."

Adrian shrugged. "It's only human to feel things. Surely it beats being numb all the time?"

"It does. I just need some getting used to is all."

"Exactly. Anyway, what's our plan? Do we continue with our project?"

"Fuck to the no. We're not in a hurry, and we may aswell check out our new gaming console. Oh, sweet, we've got 10K bears for the car job well done, twice what was promised. I guess we did something right." - Vici wanted to open her phone to find something to watch later, but couldn't help but to check the notifications beforehand.

They still finished the project before the day was over.

S2E6 The Only Way To Get Ahead

Adrian, Victoria and Jason were sitting inside the same room the first two spent their free time together, waiting for Kate to arrive. She eventually did, closed the door and sat down along with everyone else. It was a weekend, so they didn't need to go to school for 2 days.

"Alright. Hit us with it. What's the big mission? Are we attacking a building full of vampires?" - Kate asked.

"Wait, full stop. What do you mean by 'vampires'?" - Vici asked.

"They're local criminals who tend to break into homes to steal people's blood for some reason."

"I can actually contribute to this conversation. Sometimes they hit blood banks and hospitals to scrape any they can find. They occasionally murder people in their homes or on raids too." - Jason added.

"I've also read reports that they sell special extra addictive drugs laced with blood. They don't have a dress code, they're just living among us somewhere."

Victoria was spinning a triangle ruler made out of ice, mesmerized by the sight. "Sounds like a fun bunch. I wonder if they're foreign saboteurs or something. Either way, the reason why we called this emergency meeting was because we're out of easy ways to earn money. Tell 'em." - she tapped Adrian's shoulder.

"Oh. Yea, we've amassed a few tens of thousands of bears and have more or less properly equipped ourselves, but we're still quite poor and we don't nearly have everything we need. We knew this could happen, so we prepared several contingency tasks we could do, and we've decided the best one we're equipped to try right now is robbing a store." - he explained.

Jason shrugged. "Sounds fun, let's do it."

Kate laughed lightly. "Whaaat? Come on, guys. You know I would never agree to this."

"It's in your best interest to agree, sis. You know the biggest items on our grocery list are meant for you. A gun, the training required to use it, or maybe some overpriced garbage that would catch our eye: they all cost mountains. The rest of us are easier to satisfy." - Victoria argued.

"I am getting tired of you mocking my tastes. Please, stop." - it was clear how uncomfortable saying this felt for her.

"I'm sorry, I'll stop. What about the rest?"

"I know what you're playing at, Vici. The thing is, it's really not crucial for me to get a pistol as soon as possible, you know. I would love to get to action, yes, but I have \*some\* patience. I'll be fine."

"You might be, but I doubt you could say the same for everyone else. There's plenty of crime out there, I mean, if our school is the way it is, imagine how bad the rest of the city is. These people need you as soon as possible. "

"Why do you care about the common citizen all of a sudden?" - Kate squinted at Vici.

"I don't, but I know you do, and I am trying to make you realize that you want this most of everyone. And what do you think is gonna go wrong for the ones we robbed if we succeed? Do you really think the employees of our target store won't be able to explain to their superiors that they were completely overrun by 4 people with superior equipment? They'll be fine, they'll get a slap on the wrist and continue on with their lives, and it's not like losing, I don't know, 100K is a big deal to them. Sometimes you have to make little sacrifices in life to prioritize what's important, but this is barely even a sacrifice. It's just straight up free money with no strings attached."

Kate looked away and thought for a moment. "I can't believe you... Well, I can. It's completely in character. So let's say I agree. Why are you saying there aren't any strings attached, considering we've never done anything like this and we're very likely to get physically overpowered and caught?" - as Kate was talking, Victoria stealthily winked at Adrian, to which he approvingly nodded.

"Because we're not. Our target is a small convenience store with only around 4 employees or something around that. Most of them would be locked inside a staff room, and the 2 cashiers would be powerless to resist all 4 of us. The nearest police department is a decent distance away so they would never be able to reach us before we grab all we need and slip away." - she showed the target store on the satellite maps. There were a ton of other shops nearby and it looked like there were plenty of routes to safely escape.

"You don't just expect to march there in our usual clothes and hope there aren't cameras around to recognize us?"

"No, we've got 4 raincoats and 4 medical masks. Our faces would be fully hidden."

"And what if the cashiers wouldn't be the only people who could reach us in the store? What if the employees in the staff room manage to break out? I would have thought you took into account that things could go wrong and that you have to be prepared. We all know the trope, the drug deals and robberies and shit never go perfectly because it wouldn't be fun to watch otherwise, unless the point is to subvert the expectations of the consumer of such content."

"Of course we know." - Adrian shrugged.

"And of course we've prepared for shit going wrong, which is why we've prepared quite thoroughly despite our speed. Go ahead, Adrian." - Vici requested, to which he pulled out 3 serrated ice longswords from underneath a pillow. It was hard to get a hold of them properly with only 2 hands, but Adrian eventually managed to get to hold them up.

"You don't seriously expect us to rob a store in 2090 with just swords and our completely non lethal powers, right?" - Kate asked, confused.

"Correct, that's not all. You're gonna love this one." - she took a non-transparent food container from behind herself and opened it after placing it on her knees. Inside was a pistol made of ice, which she took in her free hand and showed from different sides. "Beautiful, isn't she?"

"That's very pretty. But um, why does the safety look so weird? One near the handle and one on top right?"

"This? It's the second trigger, in case the first one gets jammed. Is that not how it works?"

Kate wheezed. Adrian and Victoria looked at eachother awkwardly, both thinking "We fucked up", just in slightly different words. "My god. Ignoring the fact that someone might easily figure out that a gun made out of ice doesn't actually have any gunpowder to launch bullets with, that lever doesn't nearly look the same as a trigger, and it's there to prevent yourself from accidentally shooting yourself in the leg." - Kate's voice abruptly shifted to a higher pitch. "And why is there a second bullet hole? Where have you seen a double-barrel pistol, especially with the barrels positioned vertically? Come on." - she was laughing too hard to say anything more. Everyone else couldn't help but smile, except Jason who was browsing something in his phone before and looking around to try to understand what's going on.

"We considered making this with you, but we also wanted to surprise you with the end result and it didn't seem like it would be this bad." - Adrian noted in an embarrassed tone.

"Oh, no, you got me all wrong. I might be laughing at it and its details, but that's the most beautiful thing I've seen in my life. Even though it's not a gun, it resembles one and that's enough to please my eyes. Stunning looks aside, let's make it more life-accurate before we head out. Should only take like 15 minutes."

"Alright. Boys, I hate to say it, but it's probably best if you hang out together for a bit while we're doing this so we're done sooner." - Vici requested.

Jason was quickly on his way out, still silently browsing something on his phone. "We'll be fine. Have fun, you two. I'd love to see the end result." - Adrian gave her a quick hug and also left.

He decided to lie on his parents' made bed and look for something to watch as Jason went to get some food.

\*or was it not his parents, needs verification to avoid continuity error\*

By the time he found a history video about the last US president to watch, Jason came back with a large container full of unpeeled apple slices and laid next to him. Didn't look like the container was originally sold with these apples, but it wasn't possible to verify with the marking being gone.

"Never took you for someone with a giant stomach. Unless you want to share some." - Adrian admitted, pausing the video.

"That wasn't the plan, but feel free to eat as many as you need. I've bought tons." - Jason didn't hesitate to immediately start eating. After a few seconds, Adrian joined in too.

"Why apples, specifically, and why that many? Isn't it better to eat a variety of food?"

"That's true, but apples are sweet, juicy, filling and cheap. It's the perfect filler food."

"You might be onto something, these are amazing. Are these natural? They sure taste like it."

"Nope, all synth."

"That's incredible. Anyway, how's things?"

"They certainly could be better. I am glad to be invited to a major job with you three, but I really wish we could hang out beyond that. Like right now."

"Oh…" - it took Adrian a moment to think it over. "What about Kate? Is something wrong with her?"

"Yes, she is pissed at me. Can't say why exactly."

"That's okay, it's more interesting if you don't say that anyway. Leaves me with plenty of room to speculate on my own about what it was. Maybe you sold drugs to a first grader, or tried to start a fire in the school. Or what if you managed to trap someone on a tree with no way down? Vici could probably think of something even wilder." - Adrian said, smiling.

"Haha. Yea." - the awkwardness was written all over Jason's voice, but Adrian just assumed he was just sad or ashamed.

He then clapped Jason's shoulder twice. "Still, don't beat yourself up for it. Both me and Vici have pissed off Kate before, that's just the kind of person she is. You'll make up eventually."

"I really hope so. I still wish \*we\* could spend more time together."

Adrian took a few seconds to finish chewing. "Me too. But me and Vici are busy working half the time and busy spending our free time together for the rest of it. We could probably watch something with just 3 of us, but when we do that with Kate, it gets overwhelming at times."

"Overwhelming? I thought you all had an amazing dynamic between one another."

"Of course we do, and I love spending time with her, but she is \*hyper\*. It's not bad on its own, but every time she is around Vici, Vici gets the same kind of hyper. It's like she changes her brain frequency to resonate with Kate properly, and that's the overwhelming part. Again, they're extremely fun that way, even if I can't quite keep up, but spending time with them for long enough when they're together is too much for my head. I don't know how to explain it, it's like a mix of my ears and my brain getting overloaded."

Jason turned his head away sadly. "That's really unfortunate."

"We still care about you, though. At least me and Vici. She treats people she considers business partners or henchmen or pawns very differently from how she treats you, even if you don't know eachother all too well. I am sure Kate cares too, in her own way. And I just straight up like you."

"I am really happy to hear that. Thank you so much for inviting me here, even if four is a crowd."

"No problem! And hey, maybe you can find some active friends in school or somewhere else. Sure, we literally live together, but I also get the desire to just sit next to someone and watch random stupid videos about whatever the algorithm suggests in your freetime. Speaking of, wanna see a video about the history of the last US president?"

"Not big into history, but sure."

After the group ventured out towards their target later, all dressed up in raincoats, cleaning gloves and medical masks with holes to the sides, they were seen laughing about something. Kate and Adrian were laughing loudly, the rest - less so.

"One last score, Kate, and we got enough money to leave. Not sure where, but we'll figure out that part later." - Adrian said.

"Pärnu, Adrian. Nightclubs, beaches, cargo ships and some of the best gosh darn electronic plants in the country." - Kate explained. They were all speaking in heavy cowboy accents, but Kate's one was the heaviest and the most lifelike out of all of them.

"Porno is a real weird name for a town, partner." - Victoria commented. Her accent wasn't as heavy, but it was still believable.

"Ts'all real, cowpoke. It's in the Baltics. That area became everyone's favorite after Crimea and Sochi got turned into uninhabitable darn hellholes."

"Well ain't that fascinatin'."

"This is it, cowboys! One last time! Hyaa!"

"The law ain't gon get us! Hyaa!" - Jason added.

Everyone else joined in with their hyaa's before beginning to gallop across the streets like horses.

After arriving to the target store with a giant purple sign of "Rocket" with a logo of a cartoonishly thick rocket in orbit, 3 out of 4 of them leaned against a wall while Victoria went to do a circle around the building. After coming back to the front after a minute, she asked:

"I am finished. Gang, what's your sigma?"

"What do you mean 'what's your sigma'? The fuck does that even mean, V?" - K asked and laughed. And yes, they switched to using the first letters of their names instead of real names.

"Depends on the context, K. V, it's all empty besides the 2 cashiers. We're ready when you are." - codename A answered.

"Alright. Everyone ready?" - V asked.

"I need to check my delta first." - K japed.

"Shut up, K, or I'll hit you with a prime alpha." - V's tone of voice remained focused while clearly indicating banter.

"I need to go to the bathroom." - J said.

"Stop making funny jokes, this is serious." - V said, doing her best to remain focused.

"I really need to. Number two."

A wheezed and K covered her mouth. "Alright, fuck this. We're doing this, cowboys. Let's go."

They entered the store. V quietly locked the entrance with ice, walked to the staff room and locked it too. The rest started looking around, some thinking what should they steal, some pretending to think what should they buy, not that there was any way to tell, not even who was who. After V was done locking the staff door, she beckoned the posse to the counter before quickly drawing her new revised ice pistol at the empty-faced cashiers and turning off the "safety". The fake pistol had a believable-looking silencer this time. The rest drew their ice swords and pointed them at the cashiers too.

"Lady and gentleman, this is a hold up. Hands in the air and step outside the counter, come on. We don't have all day."

One cashier shrugged, the other sighed, both of them complied. The robbers kept a good distance away from the cashiers to avoid "Aren't you kids a little young to be committing felonies?" - the male one asked.

"Aren't you a little old to be stupid? It only takes one good stab to the belly to send you on a date with Jesus, so you better shut up and do what we say." - A ordered, full of adrenaline.

"Guys, we missed someone! Look!" - K alarmed everyone and pointed her free hand at a late middle-aged man with a focused expression staring at everyone from across the shop. Some pounding along with unintelligible speech has been heard from the staff room door and lasted around 40 seconds.

"Stay frosty or we'll kill all of you. Not a move." - V ordered. The stranger silently started walking towards the group. "Prepare to stab the cashiers if they make any sudden movements, y'all. I've got the hero." - she began approaching the hero in question before J levitated him into the air.

"Huh? What the-" - the man asked in panic.

"Good job, J."

As the robbers quickly handcuffed the hostages and placed them against a shelf, A was busy looking for the key to unlock each cash register and then stuffing his pockets with all the money inside.

"There's fuck all money here, V! There's only like 6 to 8 thousand in total."

"In both cash registers?" - she asked.

"Yes."

V approached the hostages with a newly assembled ice dagger, but stopped when the cashiers started talking. "The day has barely even started, of course we don't have much. The safe money was collected just 2 days ago also, there's not much more there." - the male one explained.

"You're walking us there or I am cutting off your eyes. Choose wisely." - V asked.

"Let's get this over with."

V freed the cashier and gestured him to move towards the staff room with her head, the ice pistol aimed at him. "J, you're coming with me. Stay behind us. The rest of you, guard the hostages and don't hesitate to kill them if they even breathe the wrong way."

"Are we… fine to do that?" - K asked.

"Yes. Just if you're killing them, kill them fast so they don't scream much. We'll be fine." - her tone was tense, yet composed.

After K, J and the male cashier went away, K commented:

"I am starting to doubt this was a good idea."

"Anxious that we should have been gone 3 times over by now? Yea, same." - A was moderately hyperventilating.

"That too, but even if we get away, which I doubt we will, considering everyone who passed by probably noticed the commotion inside, this just feels bad. I shouldn't be doing this."

"It's never too late to free us and redeem yourself. We'll put a good word for you two to the police." - the remaining cashier promised.

A kicked her in the knees. She didn't even flinch. "Shut up, adults are talking. Look, K, I can feel that you're struggling to process what's happening, but remember: this is for the greater good. We're doing what must be done."

"That doesn't-" - the customer hostage from earlier began.

"One more sound from you and the cops would have to clean up what's left of you from the floor. You think I can't do that? I can, and I will. You won't be so tough when I split you in two. Hundred. Try me." - A moved closer to him and made a small puncture on the hostage's upper lip with the tip of his sword. He was bluffing, he just didn't want either of them to say anything which would get K to change her mind. The customer just frowned at him and silence took over the room.

"Whoa, stay where you are there, cowboy. You can't leave, I've locked the door from the other side. Not one move, or I'll shoot both of ya. J, do the thing. Good, now cut off his left thumb for being stupid." - V's extra fast voice from the other room was heard.

"Please, no!" - a hispanic accent pleaded.

"Okay, but only because you asked nicely. On the ground, and hands behind your back. Go on."

After around a minute of looting the safe, V beckoned A and K to the staff room and everyone escaped through the back door and started quickly walking away (but not sprinting) through random streets and alleys in chaotic patterns.

"I think we're clear, baby! We did it!" - Adrian celebrated by joyfully jumping in the air.

"We won! We handled that so well. We probably can't actually tell if we did until a few days later, but we might just have gotten away with it. Oh, I have never been happier in my entire life. The air has never felt sweeter, the oxygen is intoxicating." - Vici also celebrated. She was talking noticeably faster than usual. "You carried the job, J. I don't know if it's safe to use real names yet. Good job."

"I am glad you think so, that was a ton of fun!" - Jason replied, although less drunk on adrenaline than Adrian or Victoria.

"You probably didn't hear it, but I kicked the remaining cashier and told her to shut up because 'the adults are talking'! I can't believe I said that to someone. I feel strong enough to lift a mountain!" - Adrian bragged.

"Hell yea. You showed them. \*We\* showed them. What about you, Kate? You're barely saying anything." - Vici asked.

"Oh, I was just thinking. I didn't expect this to be so brutal. I know we barely even harmed anyone, but I feel like a bully. I know it was crucial for us to do it and everyone is better off this way, but I keep seeing their exhausted, harmless faces. Did you ever feel this way too?"

"Of course I did. But here's what I told Adrian already which you should also know: learn to suppress that gut feeling which tells you to hit the brakes. "We might be cooked here, V. I don't see a way out. I don't think we can go through the front door, either." - K noted sadly.

"You know we can see and hear you through the security cameras, right? And there isn't exactly an abundance of people who use ice weapons. Come on, give it up. Every child in the gang stepped outside the staff zone into the lobby and congregated near Victoria. "There's gotta be something we could do. I know there's a better approach than just surrendering right now, but I can't think straight. Any ideas?"

"I don't think you ever think \*straight\*." - Adrian was still audibly tense, even if his words didn't reflect it.

"What do you- Damn it, Adrian, not now. Well, no, actually, that's exactly what I do need right now. Your stupid jokes. The good kinda stupid."

The police drove Vici, Adrian and Kate to a police station, all 3 in the back of one car. As per their requests, the first two got a shared cell, while Kate got one of her own. Jason was carried into a different car which went the other way after the arrests.

"Yea, yea, we know."

"It's probably completely impossible to hit a bank in general without someone on the inside, at least a bank that size. After the time was up, Kate was brought into the cell by 2 police officers, her dad being one of them. The other cop carried a camping chair, and both of them carried an A5 paper sheet. Adrian and Vici were watching something on one of their phones.

"Welcome, wary travellers. If you've got coin, Ad'Rian has wares." - Adrian said in a weird accent, pronouncing his name extra weirdly.

He turned off his phone and began preparing to get off the bed. "No no no, stay on the bed. It's best if we do this right here." - the other officer said as he was putting down a camping chair near the wall opposite of the bed and taking a seat on it with his A5 sheet of paper.

"Wait. Could I always use my phone in my cell? I thought you just forgot to take it." - Kate asked, sitting down on the bed next to her friends.

Adrian nodded, Victoria said "Sure", and Kate gave a thumbs up.

"You've committed an impressive list of crimes in those few hours. 2 counts of armed robberies, 4 counts of false imprisonments, 2 counts of aggravated assaults, one more with a deadly weapon, burglary, possession of a replica firearm, criminal misuse of bladed weapons, grand larceny, retail theft, which means shoplifting by the way, criminal mischief, unauthorized concealment of identity, obstruction of justice, violation of public safety, consumption and possession of alcohol by a minor and resisting arrest. \*adjust after writing the first part of the bank section properly\*

"Is it wrong that this makes me proud?" - Adrian asked. All 3 children had their own "that's bullshit" parts of the list, but nobody said a thing, even though Kate had a lot of things to say.

Despite her best efforts to keep it together, Victoria couldn't contain the giggle, which caused Adrian to laugh too through a chain reaction. Kate just stared at them judgmentally. After a few hours of detailed explanations of what happened before and during the robberies aswell as discussing the details of their support of the police, Kate left to enjoy the rest of her saturday. When Victoria entered a torture room filled with unusual headsets, a professional sound system, weird torture tools which looked custom-made, and more. "Please… I did it… Stop…" - he mumbled quietly.

The duo left the building, holding hands as always. "Even when you scold me, you just can't help but to do so in the most affectionate way possible." - Adrian noted serenely.

"Is that a challenge?" - she asked with a large smile, pausing the pinches for suspense. The smile was natural this time.

Several hours later, Victoria was sitting on a bench inside a railway station, crown back on her head, watching something. Eventually, she noticed a group of some soldiers, Bezdon, Vasiliy and a couple of adults, presumably their assigned caretakers. She stood up and approached them.

Bezdon's and Vasiliy's new caretakers frowned and stared at her initially, but then went back to normal. "The last part sounds about right. They should." - one of them said.

"Looking at the streets, you're right about the ugly paradise part. I wonder when we'll get to some corpse disposal for the mayor. "Why do you think I like power for the sake of it? Don't you remember how I helped both you and Adrian just because I wanted to? I didn't have to, but I felt like it, and so I did, despite your reputation." - Vasiliy sounded confused and slightly offended.

"I remember, of course, and I appreciate that. Still, you did accept being elected as the leader of GOEW.
