I am not judging you, I am just saying..." - Victoria started whispering to make herself sound gentler. "Embrace your inner darkness. It's nothing to be ashamed of."

"Oooh! You're right. From now on, I embrace the void. Because might makes right." - he said proudly.

"You know, Vivi, you sound a lot less perpetually depressed these days. You genuinely seem so much happier, more open, less cold… And you've never gotten philosophical with us, let alone tried to become our lifestyle coach." - Bezdon observed.

"Are you saying she's serious?"

"Why wouldn't she be?"

"Bro." - Vasiliy made an awkward face. The "B" was very loud.

"I am curious. If you view him as someone with a closeted dark side, what does that make me?"

"I've always respected you for just going around the lab and destroying everyone. Sometimes for money, sometimes for fun. No allegiances, little principles, just being an honest fighter. I never considered you a friend, but… I don't know. You're just cool, and there's not a single thing about you which I dislike." - Victoria admitted with a much more thoughtful and emotionless tone than earlier.

"You're capable of compliments? That's \*insane\*." - Bezdon was genuinely pleasantly shocked.

She turned away and smiled. "Heh. I'm losing my edge, ain't I?"

"Cap. Remember the torture chamber? Didn't seem like you've lost your edge there." - Adrian reassured.

"The \*what\*?" - Vasiliy was surprised.

"We'll tell you the full story later."

"I haven't been there for whatever happened in the torture chamber, but maybe you've just gained a new internal face rather than changing to be less threatening. To your peers, anyway." - Bezdon suggested.

"Not even just peers anymore. She's capable of a lot more than just that deathly coldness we're all too familiar with, and her skills will only get honed with time as she tries over and perfects different approaches." - Adrian turned sideways along with his phone.

"Alright, alright." - Vici couldn't decide between sarcastically rebuking them both for reassuring her or genuinely just saying "thanks", but after a few moments, she chose the third option. "You know, Bez, how come you don't have your void tentacles anymore?"

"They didn't allow me to have them always spread out like you've always seen me do. Because it 'makes me stand out a lot' or something, total bullshit."

"We've told you, someone might kill you and try to harvest you. I am sorry, but it's critical for your own safety and there's simply no other way. You need to make sure that the only people who see it are police officers and military members, or if you know for sure they will die or get caught shortly after they see it, which is all, of course, null and void if your life is in danger or it's important for the mission." - his assigned step-dad explained.

"We've been told something similar about Vici and her ice. Considering the crown is fine, only manipulation of ice seems like something she can't do, but using pre-made ice equipment is fine. Personally, I also think it's complete horseshit. Born with these amazing powers and I can't even prank unsuspecting people with it. It's my favorite thing ever." - Adrian admitted with frustration.

"Adrian, Bezdon, please, use your head and think. There's a high chance the abilities you possess are exclusive to you and you alone in the whole wide world of around 9 billion. People are jealous, and sometimes not even the social structure of the Motherland is enough to deter people from trying to harvest what makes you tick like a common bionic eye or leg. We can't assign a robot to monitor all of you all day as that would almost certainly make you feel chained and might compromise some of the tasks you might be given…"

"Yea, no shit." - Victoria confirmed, frustrated.

"But guys, please. You are the future of Omnislavia and all that is righteous, all of you. It's amazing what modern medicine can do, we can even conditionally cure death, but if one of \*you\* dies, the body would detonate from inside as a failsafe against being captured by enemy countries, and at that point there wouldn't be enough of you left to resurrect."

A tense silence filled the dirty, just barely tolerable air of the van.

"The fuck do you \*mean\* we're rigged to explode on death? You're literally leaving an opening for enemies to hack our detonation devices from the outside and kill us without a fight. How is that a good system?" - Victoria's frustration spiked.

"There's nothing to hack in a traditional way, it's completely offline. There are even several failsafes to prevent something like EM storms from detonating you. The only way you're combusting is if the device gets a relatively long confirmation on several levels that you're completely and thoroughly dead. It even registers what kind of death you've suffered, preventing detonation if you drown, for example." - the boys' new step-mom explained.

"Hmph." - Vici gave her a judgmental side eye, still not content with the prospect of being rigged with an explosive.

Another couple hours later, Vasiliy, Bezdon, Adrian, Victoria and Kate were on the same bed where Adrian and Jason were talking earlier, left to right with Kate furthest on the right. She was looking at something in the fancy phone in her hands. There was an empty chair opposite of them.

"May aswell take a look at the recording. The screen is really small, though. Gonna be hard to see anything." - she observed sadly.

"What about the huge TV on your left?" - Vasiliy asked.

"Can we even connect to that?"

"Worth a shot. Adrian, can you grab the remote under it and press the big red button?" - Victoria said before stretching out on the bed to the left side. Everyone else soon followed, other than Adrian who was busy with the remote.

"Where do I lie down?" - Vasiliy asked.

"You're gonna have to grab that chair we put Kate's phone on. Probably better than trying to squeeze yourself between us somewhere. Adrian, is it not working?" - Vici asked, noticing that Adrian had been fruitlessly pressing a button over and over.

"Damn it, okay." - Vasiliy grabbed the chair and positioned it to the side of the bed so he could fit. He didn't sound that bothered.

"Nope. Pressing the red button, no results. Oh, there's a different one here. What if-" - he pressed it, and the TV was lit up with a news program. "Damn. Now, where can I lie down?" - he handed Kate the remote.

"You can take your place on my lap. I can make you a headrest with my arms after me and Kate are done figuring out how to connect her phone to the big screen." - Victoria offered.

"Assuming I won't crush you, that sounds good." Everyone else looked like they had something to say about the offer, but only Kate said anything, and it was just "Aww".

As they were busy figuring out the controls, the TV was projecting today's news about how a bank and a store were robbed by dissident children in Murmansk, who have been successfully captured and admitted to a military school for rehabilitation. In other news, the average income has increased by 1.3% over the last month alone and 157 missiles fired by Pakistan have all been intercepted, and a whole other load of nonsense which the children had absolutely no way to tell what was and wasn't real. Eventually, they finished setting it up and played the recording on the big screen.

The TV showed Adrian, Vici and Kate sitting in a line on the right side of the same bed. The left side of the camera view was weirdly empty, like they forgot to put themselves in the center of the view.

"Hello there." - Adrian opened.

"Hey. We've been offered to send you guys a video message of us in Murmansk by the adults, so here we are. The TLDR is, this city has everything we've ever wanted, pretty much all the things we didn't have available before. But the city is also struggling with a ton of problems and it's generally just in a sad state." - Kate narrated.

"Which means there's a load of things to do, problems to solve, problems to create, money to be made, discord to spread. Friends to be made too, probably, but having eachother was enough." - Victoria continued, counting upsides of moving out with fingers.

"...Yea, it really depends on how you look at it."

"But seriously, come here and join us. I won't even shower you with a hailstorm of ice shards. Probably." - Kate covered her mouth, silencing a laugh.

"God damn it, Vici." - present Kate remarked, borderline laughing.

"I mean, honesty is important sometimes." - present Victoria shrugged.

"I don't think I need to say which outlook I am choosing on all this." - past Adrian said with a sparkling smile. "Either way, we're not the only ones here at this point. Meet the new arrivals." - he signaled Bezdon and Vasiliy with his right arm to come out from behind the camera and fill the weird empty space on the bed to the left, which was intended for them all along. "How do you feel about the prospect of living in this city with us, Mr. Eldritch Monster?" - Adrian asked like a reporter before pulling out a pencil from his pocket and putting it in front of Bezdon's mouth like a microphone.

"Heard the locals aren't very receptive to beaten the fuck out of, but I'll probably find a way to apply myself somewhere." - he answered.

"Okay, thank you, Mr. Eldritch Monster. What about you, Mr. Fellow Psychic?" - Adrian gave Vasiliy the pencil.

"I am still too early to judge anything, but it sounds like I will both get my giant dog and have something to do in my freetime." - Vasiliy shrugged. "Best idea we've ever had collectively. Thank you for the opportunity, Victoria, I really regret not supporting you from the start."

"Don't even trip about it. Your support as a human shield has been most helpful." - she replied, causing everyone to wheeze and laugh, with even Vasiliy shaking his head and smiling. The children of the present also couldn't help but to laugh along.

"You did that? Why am I not surprised?" - past Kate asked with a smile of disappointment.

"I wonder why, me." - present Kate agreed with an intensely sarcastic tone.

"Should have said that was a violation so I would spend a few minutes arguing otherwise and losing my concentration." - past Vici shrugged.

"Alright, alright, does anyone have anything else to say before we stop the recording? I've got a few words for the old gang." - Adrian asked, recovering from the nuclear warhead Vici dropped.

"I've got some for \*my\* old gang too." - Kate said.

"I've also got something I'd like to leave for last. Mind if Adrian goes first? Actually, no, nevermind. You guys pick." - Victoria offered as she started rapidly typing something on her phone.

"That's okay, I can wait. Hit 'em with it, Kate." - Adrian wanted to pass the pencil to Kate before realizing he didn't take it from Vasiliy. It would have been too awkward to get it back for such a performative gesture.

Kate started going on about how great it would be to see her friends again and how she misses them. At the same time, Vici showed Adrian whatever she wrote on her phone, after which he crawled backwards deeper onto the bed, then to his left, and gave Kate a middle finger devil horn on her left side. Victoria moved closer and did the same with the other side when she noticed.

Kate turned her head around. "What are you doing? You're ruining my speech." - all 3 of them laughed intensely while Bezdon watched with amusement and Vasiliy couldn't help but smile.

The present kids were also amused by the interaction, even if their reactions were a lot more muted. "Your sociopathic personality will never properly hide the fact that you're a giant doofus." - present Kate commented.

"Well now you're just flirting with me." - present Victoria responded, smiling. Present Kate shook her head awkwardly and didn't respond, and present Adrian snore-laughed.

After past Kate was done, past Vici said:

"Oh, almost forgot. To the same people as Kate's message was addressed…" - she flipped a bird at the camera and grinned. "I hope you die a painful death, you insufferable wastes."

Vasiliy looked at her with concern, Bezdon laughed quietly, Adrian put his lips between his teeth, and Kate wanted to say something before interrupting herself, turning her head away from everyone and covering her mouth for a decent while. Present Kate also turned her head away and started repeatedly blinking for a while, present Victoria closed her eyes for a moment and took a deep breath, and present Adrian, Bezdon and Vasiliy changed their facial expressions to sadness, awkwardness and awkwardness again.

"Well, my turn." - Past Adrian announced abruptly before proceeding to address his old friends, saying how even though they weren't talking together for a while, it's been great spending time together and even though he doesn't have time to spend much time together due to other priorities, he has some time and opportunities for games so it's not all bad.

Lastly, it was Vici's turn to speak:

"Moni, get your ass over here. I know it'll take a few months worst case scenario for your whole block to get here, but still. Just doesn't feel right otherwise, you know."

"It's her weird way of saying we miss you. Which we do." - Adrian transcribed.

She sighed. "Okay, that about does it. Kate, you can end the recording." - Kate took the phone from the chair into her own hands, everyone waved and said extra goodbyes, and playback ended.

"That was great, wasn't it?" - present Adrian asked.

"No. Will need to cut some stuff out. Maybe the adults can handle it for us." - Vici replied.

"Didn't you say you wanted to keep as much of it together to keep the natural chaos of the recording intact, even if it hurts the pacing?" - Bezdon asked.

"Yes, and I haven't changed my mind. But I feel like we really shouldn't send it in with me saying \*that\* to Kate's friends. It's not like I didn't mean it, I did, and I do wish the worst on them. At the same time, they'll probably perceive this as a threat, which they're guaranteed to take seriously, which could backfire in a plethora of ways. No, we have to cut it out, as good as it did feel to say it."

"Thank you. I really wanted to ask that but I didn't think I had any right to say anything." - Kate said sadly, her head still turned away.

"Right? Are you still on about that? Come on, snap out of it." - Victoria grabbed Kate's shoulder and gave it a noticeable shake.

"You're not a henchwoman to me, you have the right to be honest to me. Don't strip yourself of your agency, that just makes me feel like an abusive camazon."

Next morning, Adrian and Vici were taking a walk outside.

"We're getting close. It's about time I've revealed the surprise." - she started in a mildly excited voice before pulling out 2 packs of white sticky notes from a pocket along with 2 pens, giving one of the sets to Adrian.

"Sticky notes? Thought you wanted to go here to rest from work. Are you planning on folding them into what looks like drones so we could clear the cash register?" - Adrian clicked the pen a few times because he could. And the sound was nice.

"Heh. I am not that deranged. It's not for something else. You see, these may look like ancient low-volume flash drives, and to a casual observer, that's all they are. However, these are also weapons of mass destruction. Let me give you a demonstration." - she stopped, wrote something on a note and showed Adrian. "Avoid the bald man or you will die. Hmm…"

"That's not all." - Vici turned around, put the pen and sticky notes in one hand, took out the top one with a free hand and attached the note to a car window before brushing her free hand with the back of her occupied one. It really didn't look as cool as she wanted it to. "There. Now the owner of this car will fear bald people for the rest of their life. And that is how you spread \*terror\*." - she made an evil laugh.

"That's foul. And awesome. Are we gonna get in trouble over this?"

"How? That's the thing, we're just giving people cryptic messages in the eyes of the law. Not violent, not coherent, just random bullshit. Try it."

"Okay, okay. Here goes." - Adrian made another note and showed it off with a smile.

"No, no, you're missing the point. You gotta be less direct. It's scary, for sure, but they'll probably just be a little shocked for one day and get over it when they realize everything is fine. You gotta have more finesse, more details, while being vague enough to for sure get some right. Or you could lean into heart attack in the moment through lying about something bad happening."

"Ooooh, got it. Here's a better one." - Adrian made a notion for sticking the note into a random grate.

"You can still stick it onto a car. It's not like we don't have enough of them to go around. I'll write an example of leaning into terror in the moment angle."

"What's it gonna be this time?" - he asked with curiosity, attaching his sticky note to a different other car. It said, "I will steal your kidney and cook it for dinner".

Victoria finished her new note and stuck it to a rear window of another car after showing the contents to Adrian. It read, "Sorry for scratching your car :(". "It's not overtly threatening, but it's gonna give the owner a hell of a heart attack followed by intense disappointment in allowing themselves to be fooled like that. How do you like it?"

"You're just too awesome. You're powerful enough to ruin someone's day in 20 seconds. That's gotta be a record, right?" - Adrian asked joyfully.

"I could pop any of these tires with an ice needle in 3. Not that I care to. Anyway, show me what you had in mind." - Adrian wrote and showed off, "Bring us a litre of blood or there will be consequences - The Vamps". "Yessss. You're using an example of real people who could actually pose danger for all anyone knows, with realistic motives. You've done well, my apprentice. Let's see if I can one up that."

And so they kept going, and going, and going, making and sticking notes ranging from heinous to absolutely vile. They eventually reached the target theme park of Fruitnaz and its parking lot and continued having fun with notes until they got bored 19 sticky notes later and finally went to buy tickets inside. The line only had a couple of people before it was their turn.

"Are your parents around?" - an elderly lady asked at the counter. Adrian was pretty sure he saw starving African children from media less underweight than her.

"No, they're not. We don't have parents." - Victoria answered.

"Uh huh. Sorry, children, you need parental supervision to be in here." - it was obvious she didn't buy it.

"We're with the military. We're grown enough to not cause any damage." - Victoria showed her own and Adrian's dark green ID cards with a beautiful logo of a golden lightbulb orbited by 3 electrons on the back side and "OMP MLB" underneath. Omnislavian Ministry of Peace, Mind of Liberty Branch.

After successfully buying the tickets for a total of 5.6K bears and surrendering Adrian's dull ice sword, they've been successfully allowed inside.

"We're in. Where do you wanna go?" - Vici asked.

"Where do \*you\* wanna go? I never watched this shitty cartoon from the 60's. I always found it stupid how the vegetables were always the bad guys who did bad things because they were bad."

"That's just in the episodes past 2079, the rest of it is great. These must be references to even newer episodes here, though. Happle's Gravity Exercises, Melly's and Lemmy's Mineshafts, Harrlick's Deadly Attack? Dude, he was annihilated across all universes by the Brawlnana Council because his voice actor was jailed for funding dissidents, and now they've brought him back for some reason? Okay, bro. No wonder there's so little people here." - her speed of speech was gradually accelerating.

"I guess I choose the mineshafts. You know, maybe I do need to give the older seasons a go with you. What if you're right? Also, how did you always dream of going to a place like this and then have no conception of what to do?"

Victoria shrugged. "No idea. It just always felt too distant to really think about."

As they were waiting in a green and yellow hall filled with frames of Melly and Lemmy doing all kinds of stuff together, from fighting a zombie tomato apocalypse with M16's to sniffing flowers, a family of 3 ahead in the line had a toddler who wouldn't stop loudly crying.

"God, if I have to endure this crying for one more minute… Not even shutting my ears works, he's just so loud." - Adrian suffered with his face covered.

"Are you okay, hun? Do I need to sort this out?" - Vici offered tenderly, trying to comfort him with shoulder pets.

"No… I can wait some more. It's all good."

"I hear you loud and clear." - she stood up and stood in front of the family up ahead. "Hey you, shut your fucking camazonling before I do something. You're not all alone here, you're hurting someone I care about." - Vici requested with mild anger.

"How dare you call my perfect, beautiful, sweet bunbun that? You kiss your mother with that tongue?" - the toddler's mom yelled back. The her preteen daughter just laid back and closed her eyes.

"Bitch, he is polluting the air with his stench and his devilish screams. Don't try to make everyone else suffer for your complete lack of competence as a mother, it's all your fault." - her volume grew.

"Aren't you a little short to be telling me how to be a mother, little girl? Sit the hell down."

"I am more adult than you, shitface. You're only admitting defeat by using the age card. Shut your little devil up already."

But her intervention didn't help. The toddler never ceased crying, and the yells and cries of everyone formed an insufferable, devilish cacaphony of raw nightmares, which made Adrian feel even worse.

The duo eventually walked out of the building, heading for Happle's Gravity Exercises. Adrian looked the most dead inside he ever has, and Vici's face has turned red from the whole exchange.

"How fucking entitled do some people have to be? She could always gag the little imp, or tape his mouth shut, or give him one of those infant mouth lids, but she didn't. She just wanted to make everyone around her suffer and earbleed. I am definitely gonna pop a tire with my ice spikes on the way out, maybe even a few. Might even smash a few windows for dessert, or maybe even kick a hobo if none of that helps. Jesus, I hate humanity. Maybe being destined to kill people until I die was the best thing that ever happened to me." - she ranted, speaking much faster than usual. "Overwhelmed? I can understand. Maybe one day we can earn a licence to kill so we can dissuade assholes from ruining our day with a single silent stare."

Waiting in the Happle building was no problem, even if it took a while and even if Adrian never said a single word. It was themed about the same as the previous one, except it was red, yellow and green, and there was Happle instead of Lemmy or Melly. Eventually, they were allowed into a small cabin which was very slowly moved up around 15m into the sky before slowly descending back down, part of a conga line of other cabins. It was mostly transparent.

"Do you feel any better? I am starting to get worried." - Victoria asked Adrian when they were around 11m in the air.

He sighed, staring at the floor. "Yea. Just, thinking about whatever we're riding right now."

"Still trying to recover?"

"I've recovered, no worries." - he took a look at the many bite marks on his left arm. "Just trying to understand why are these things so slow. They've remade the ferris wheel, yet still kept it insanely slow. They wouldn't be made if nobody liked them, but I just don't get what I'm missing. I don't feel bored right now, I am always happy to be near you, but I know other people don't have the same privilege."

"You're not wrong to wonder about that." - she paused for a few seconds. "Personally, though, I have everything I've ever wanted in life. Friends, money, something to do. And you." - Vici took a quick breath with closed eyes and slowly kissed Adrian's cheek.

He turned his head towards her and smiled, feeling euphoric. "I was wondering when you were gonna do that."

"I was wondering when \*you\* were gonna do that."

"Oh no, are we gonna make a habit of talking like this?" - he produced a small exhale.

"Don't you dare switch topic in this moment. Do it." - Victoria requested playfully. "Unless you're having second thoughts, of course."

"Okay, okay." - he complied, also choosing a cheek even though the forehead would have made an easier target. "Wasn't trying to weasel out of this. Thought you'd appreciate the irony."

"I did, actually." - she embraced him. "I guess now we know the real purpose of these slow ass things."

"Yes…"

They sat back in their normal positions, arms behind eachothers' backs this time. "You know, I really hoped you'd go first and I'd be forced to see if I still hate it. The kissing business back in the lab may have helped us financially, but it was also so uncomfortable. And it's not like I could do much more, I've made my prices sky high and it's like it didn't matter at all. Should have made them even higher by 10 tokens."

"You never told me." - Adrian replied sadly.

"Because my feelings didn't matter, and there's no use dwelling on feelings detrimental to the task at hand. An unfortunate residue remained, but I did what I had to do. If you're ready for a storytime, I can elaborate further."

He performatively shook his head in surprise with wide eyes. "Is that even a question? Of course I am ready."

"I don't know. I am new to this 'being considerate' thing." - Vici's tone shifted to sad for the first time in a while. "You know, the 20K deal responsible for us being here now? It was offered to me not long after the disaster. It was plainly just mockery, a way to stomp me into the ground even further, standard adult behavior. The moment I awakened as a Starblood, you know what's the first thing I tried to do. Or, at least, you can guess."

"I think so. Thank fuck for the adults."

"Agreed. After that didn't work, I realized that, hey, I am a fucking Starblood, maybe there's another way out, and so I camped the roads and attacked random people to learn how to fight. It felt rude, but failure was always more painful, and so I knew what I had to do: suck it up, concentrate and do it. Not long after, my success rates started approaching 100%, and I switched to doing this for tokens in hopes that one day I'll earn enough to buy my freedom. 2 months later I was completely numb to any discomfort that came with it."

"Even if you were only 2 or 3 times stronger than average, you would have reached 16 years before you could reach that. So, what happened?"

"Oh, it was even worse in reality. I'd say I was about 1.5 times stronger than average by that point, but I knew my powers and technique would grow and that'd improve, and they did."

"Can attest to that."

"However, that didn't help enough. Around 1.5 years later, I noticed my income was stagnant, and I found out why. You can't achieve success in this world with pure brawn, and so I started relearning how to talk with people. Sofia served me as a wonderful target dummy, I think she enjoyed how fucked in the head I was."

"And then you've learnt how to apply your social skills to earn money?"

"Of course, that was the point. It felt even weirder at first, especially how I couldn't tell Sofia I looked at her as a business partner rather than a friend, but by now you know how I overcame that." - Vici's tone became less sad.

"Swallow it up and do it."

"Or not do it, like in her case. And don't spoil the future arc where I'll have to seduce and fuck people for the sake of whatever mission I'll be given, we're still 7 years early for swallowing." - she produced a strained laugh and looked downwards.

Adrian was a little disturbed by this, and so he looked down too, then back at her. The reason why Vici brought this up so suddenly completely flew over his head. "But it's no problem for \*the technique\*, right?"

Victoria went back to a neutral tone and looked forward again. "Exactly. And now you know where my power of distancing comes from. Fear, happiness, sadness, boredom, shock and especially anger: all can be exploited to suck their wearers dry. I needed to be strong enough to do that without remorse, and I have adjusted myself accordingly."

"Is that how Revenge of the Girls happened? It was all your elaborate scheme, wasn't it?"

Victoria smiled. "I wish. I've developed the reputation of being the lab's most relentless merc by then, but I wasn't actually included much anywhere, unless someone needed a good icing. The reason why I was invited on board with the plan in the first place was my complete lack of morals and them doing this for anything and everything other than tokens, which means I could have every single one I could extort in the process."

"Heh, clever. I don't feel so bad about getting mugged by you anymore. So what happened after the plan was successfully executed?"

"They've all got pretty much what they wanted. Some boys thought themselves above such coercion, considering they had adults on their side, so that took some laundry work. Laundry work I've been plentifully paid for. But we're getting off topic. What was the main topic, again? Yea. The point is, the kisses weren't anything different, just business as usual. Not like I had any dignity left to sacrifice."

"So you just swallow up all your pain and move on? That's so impressive. You have a will of steel." - Adrian was in mild awe.

"Exactly, and I hope to teach you to be like this too." - it took all her willpower not to make the same joke twice.

After an hour of trying out random stuff, as they were scouring the place for the next thing to check out, Adrian asked:

"Are you sure you're having fun?"

"I am trying to. I really am, just taking a day off so we could enjoy ourselves, but I can't hold it in much longer. The feeling deep inside my head keeps telling me that we could be at the police station making money and learning skills, not being at these mediocre rides wasting our lives." - Victoria admitted in a strained voice.

Adrian shrugged. "Big deal. I am only enjoying this because we're spending time together, not because any of those are particularly fun. I am okay to leave."

"Yes, we probably should. It's like making money is all I've ever known, and now that I can afford headspace for other activities, I still can't help but to resist the old habits."

"It's nothing like that, Vici. You're probably just getting so bored by all this that you'd rather go back to your comfort zone than stay here." - he tried to reassure her.

Victoria stared into nothing, thinking. "Comfort zone. Comfort… zone. You're not wrong, I am so used to the eternal grind that it became my comfort zone rather than work. No, I shouldn't be upset about this. It just means growth and work is natural to me and I will never have to be upset about having to do anything in terms of work. This is \*good\*." - her mood was audibly restored.

"Not what I had in mind, but that works."

Later in the day, they were having a conversation with Adrian's mom in a police station in a hallway. She also assumed the mantle of a cop.

"What. The fuck. I get that you're trying to have fun in less destructive ways, and this is absolutely an improvement, but don't you realize that people might take these notes seriously and it might disrupt their work?" - she oozed frustration. Adrian has never seen her in a mood like this.

"It's just notes filled with nonsense. How bad can they be, and even then, what kind of crime would this constitute as?" - Vici asked in the same innocent tone as earlier and shrugged.

"Criminal mischief. And don't give me those innocent eyes, Victoria. We know that you know that even small combinations of words can have immense power, even in text. No more, got it? Only legal, non-harmful ways to have fun from now on."

"Literally 1984."

S2E7 - And They Run When The Sun Comes Up

Around a week has passed since the arrival of Bezdon and Vasiliy into Murmansk. All 6 children from the lab have begun proper integration into the police, and were even provided with special badges to wear on outside jobs. In the end, thanks to their deep and efficient cooperation, everyone involved was happy to find themselves in positions they were in.

On 31st of December 2090, Adrian and Victoria entered a jail cell and found a late-middle aged man inside, tied up to a chair. He was dressed in ragged shorts, seemed to have normal weight and was not gagged.

"It's a dude. So, does he have the knowledge or the key to get to the surprise, or is he the surprise itself?" - Adrian tried to guess.

"All 3 to one degree or another. This man got a life sentence for delivering food to a dissident organization, and there was also something about domestic violence, I don't know." - she was typing something on her phone between speech.

"I've never hit my wife in my lifetime. They've interpreted a slap-like movement on-" - the man tried to explain, frustrated.

"Shut up, adults are talking." - Vici quickly pulled out an ice maraca with a free left hand and threw it at him, shattering it mid-air and covering the convict with ice shards. Or not even a convict, she wasn't actually sure, not that it mattered. "As you know, Adrian, people who get full life sentences are always either conscripted or made to do forced labor. But sometimes they're not physically or mentally able to pay back their debts that way, and the police has to dispose of them, as there's a variety of uses for both living and dead people like that."

"Living? Do we have our own Unit 731 or something?" - Adrian was surprised, but not even remotely shocked.

"I don't know. I wouldn't be surprised. Either way, I've coordinated the cops to let you do the honors of executing this guy. It took some convincing, they agreed with my methods in the end."

"Wait, already? Oh, I didn't think this would happen so soon." - he turned away and started thinking.

"Yea, sometimes life just comes at you fast, and you need to be strong enough to push through." - Victoria put away her phone,, took Adrian's sword, quickly sharpened the edges with her powers, handed it back to him, gave his shoulder a gentle pet, and took her phone again. "Dewit. It's your chance to finally ascend."

"You don't need to do this. I know I am already dead, but your mind isn't ready to handle a killing. Don't traumatize yourself just because your superiors push you to." - the tied-up man suggested, no fear in his voice.

Victoria made a quick step towards him mid speech, but stopped and thought for a moment until he was finished talking. "I was thinking to gag him to make him less distracting, but it's even better if he cries and begs you for mercy. Humanity, sentience and personal uniqueness don't absolve anyone from pain or death. So keep talking, adult."

"I have nothing to say to you, damn yandere maniac. Just because you've been ruined, it doesn't mean you must ruin your friends too."

Vici shrugged. "Tough words for a living plot device of Adrian's ascension. We're all trying to do our jobs here, and now it's time for you to do yours." - she approached Adrian and gave him another shoulder tap, putting her phone in the left hand. None of them knew whoever Yandrei was. The man looked very confused, probably at being called a "living plot device". "Dewit, Adrian. Choose your method and execute the target."

As Vici stepped away to observe with one eye and type with another, Adrian faced his target, and looked at his sword for a few moments. "Suck it up, concentrate and do it." - he whispered, and thought in his head a few times after. Eventually, he closed his eyes, took a deep breath and prepared to decapitate the prisoner in one swing of his sword. Vici smiled at him and gave him a thumbs up, but he was too focused on the task at hand. He moved closer and went for the swing, but it wasn't nearly strong enough to cut off the head, only making a bleeding cut in the neck, which caused him to panic a little. As the target was bleeding, coughing and groaning, Adrian held his hair and tried to cut through the rest of him that way, but the neck bone was too strong to cut through. Thankfully, by the time Adrian reached it, the man stopped making sounds.

"You did it! Welcome to manhood. I knew you could do it. Good save, too. How are you feeling?" - Victoria asked supportively.

"That wasn't so bad." - Adrian replied emotionlessly, walking around the cell aimlessly while looking downward with his bloodied hands behind his back and his sword back in the sheathe.

"Good, good. You have done well, my apprentice." - she channeled her inner Palpatine all the while still quickly typing something. "Now, it's best that you go home or generally spend some time alone in whatever way you're comfortable with and think it all over, start to finish. Analyze and process your feelings, introduce yourself to them if they're new, and if any of them make you feel bad, remember: you did what you had to do and there's no shame in it. This man sacrificed his life so you could live yours to the fullest."

"Mmm hmm."

"And if you need to talk about this, send me a message and I'll respond. I'll probably be busy with training or torture or pedophiles for a while, but I'll try my best to help." - Vici approached and embraced him. "I am proud of you."

After washing his hands and going home as suggested, around half an hour later he began arguing with himself over what he's done before finally internally accepting it as something completely fine and natural around 2 hours after. He was mostly using his opportunity to chat with Victoria to flirt with her, even if her one-ups were a hell of a lot more powerful than anything he could muster. He also chatted with Matt for a while about whenever replayability or the first time experience is more important in games or not, and by the end both were ranting about the first being neglected completely.

Not long before midnight, Kate and Adrian were leading Vici somewhere as she was \*still\* doing something on her phone while paying just enough attention to the road not to bump into anything. It was snowing outside, so she attached a very wide brim to her crown helmet temporarily, turning it into a crown helmet sombrero to prevent the snowflakes from landing on her screen. The brim was curved to make the rainwater pour backwards instead of forwards or sideways.

"While I don't have an exact idea where you're leading me, I sure hope it's not gonna cost us some crazy money." - Victoria said.

"Don't worry about money. I've covered everything from my own coffers." - Kate assured her.

"I know you're hardwired against getting your mind off of money, but at least give it a try. We're trying to do our best to bring you joy for once for this special day. Or night, I guess." - Adrian added.

"I second that. And you don't need to do your reverse-grooming with state-provided alt accounts all day, every day. It's not like they'll go anywhere if you take a break for the rest of the day."

Victoria paused her lightning-fast typing. "But I don't wanna take a break. I am being rewarded for my amazing performance, and I just love making sure they never see freedom again and likely die. Half a year of this and I'll rid Omnislavia of molesters entirely. Is that not an amazing goal to strive for?"

"It is, and you're doing it exceptionally well, but you're leaving no room to breathe for your soul." - Vici tumbled but regained balance. "And you're not doing that good of a job looking at the road, this is the second time. Come on. At least wait until we get there so you don't get run over by a car. Not all of them are auto-piloted." - Kate begged in an appropriate tone.

Vici finished typing something and put away her phone. "Fine. I'll get better at multitasking typing with walking. Hopefully this one won't get too impatient if I don't feed him a little while." - she reluctantly agreed, frustrated.

"Feed him? Don't tell me you mean THAT kinda feed." - Kate asked with mild disgust.

"It's nudes, Kate, yes." - Adrian replied neutrally.

"Oh god… I'm gonna puke… Why would you ever agree to this…" - she covered her mouth and turned her face away.

"They're AI generated, Kate, don't worry about it. I've got an arsenal of CP in my storage so large it'd be enough to put me away for several lifetimes if I wasn't underage myself, and it's not like I use it on \*everyone\* because that's not always optimal. You won't believe how advanced and undetectable imagegen is now, there's a reason access to that technology is restricted even to cops themselves. But at the end of the day, it's just a tool to get the job done, just like my phone, or like LemonLime." - Vici assured her, still irritated.

"Imagine waking up in 2030's and watching an AI-generated streamer play a game full of AI-generated textures with AI-generated chat on a platform monitored by AI while masturbating to AI-generated porn." - Adrian shook his head.

"He meant \*corn\*. Eating AI-generated corn. He thinks 'masturbating' means 'eating'." - Victoria tried to salvage before making a gesture of a horizontal closed hand moving up and down twice near Adrian, which was a previously established gesture of "Wrong time to say this". He began overanalyzing what he said to see what he could have possibly said at a wrong time. "Imagine if civilians could access that shit today, even if it wasn't free like back in the day. It'd be like the thirties, but even worse, reality and fiction would become one and we would all drown in a deep sea of all-encompassing uncertainty." - she sighed deeply. "Thank fuck that's not the case. I pity any country that didn't handle it the same way we did. Wait, what were we even talking about?"

Kate didn't buy the corn line, but she figured it'd be better to pretend otherwise. "Your methods. You know, I really think what you're doing is completely justified and even noble, but at the same time, I worry about you two sometimes." - Kate admitted sadly.

"Nothing to worry about, sis, we're just a little quirky is all."

Eventually they've arrived into a restaurant, \*descriptions i have no fucking clue how to do\*. As they opened the door and went inside, Adrian made a joyful "tada" while Vici detached the brim from her crown, deconstructed it into ice maracas and put them away in her vast pockets.

"We did some homework and found us and you in particular the perfect place to spend the night together! We've also reserved a table with couches and ordered all your favorite food and most of what you wanted to try out." - Kate presented.

"And you two managed to find a place with most of what I wanted in only a few hours when I was working alone today? That's impressive. And sweet. You two are the best." - Victoria expressed her gratitude as she sat down between her companions at the same time with them on a semicircular-like couch. She was pretty sure she'd cry on the spot if she didn't see the outline of the surprise a mile away, but it was still very heartwarming.

"And this isn't even the best part."

"Hey, this spot is reserved and paid for. Pick a different spot." - a sleepy young adult server dressed in orange and brown clothing approached them.

"Yea, by me." - Kate took out her phone and showed him the transaction log after a few moments of searching. "Would you mind bringing us any food which is currently ready? The special lemonade, mainly."

The server nodded and walked away. "Oh, the lemonade! Not the standard LemonLime we drink, the good shit." - Adrian's neurons flared.

"The good shit? Hell yea, you have my attention." - Vici's neurons also flared, even if it was less visible.

Kate giggled. "Sweet teeth. I hope you're enjoying the date I've taken you out to. Yes, I said it. I can make things weird too for no reason. Are you proud of me?"

Adrian laughed lightly. "Very." - Vici put her hand on Kate's shoulder.

"Oh right, we forgot something important." - she suddenly moved closer to Victoria and embraced her. Adrian did the same.

"Oh… This is surreal, even for you two. I feel weird, like reality isn't real. Even I don't feel real." - Vici admitted in a dazed tone.

"We love you too!" - Adrian said tenderly.

"We were meant to do this after the initial reveal, but I guess we just both forgot." - Kate noted.

"I would have died. Maybe I am dying already. Is this what ecstasy meant to feel like? That's not how I thought it would." - Victoria spoke uncharacteristically slowly.

"Maybe you just feel it differently. Hey, this is a perfect moment to take a group photo for the memories. Everyone, sit upright."

Everyone sat upright, except Victoria who was already in a proper position. "Yea, maybe if one of us dies in battle, the rest of us can look at it and remember the good times." - Adrian said.

Vici smiled, still stuck in the clouds. "Adrian, no. Don't make this moment depressing. I know she reinforces you when you do that, but I won't. Just try to be normal and wholesome for a few moments." - Kate requested as she was setting up the camera. It wasn't clear whenever she was genuinely frustrated or still a little entertained by the comment. Victoria was too confused by her mental state to deny that she reinforced that behavior. Eventually, they've managed to create a photo with happy Adrian making a peace sign and Kate leaning against dazed Vici who was staring into nothingness with a slight smile.

Some time later, Adrian and Kate were eating various sorts of food like a gelatinous cake and crab meat while Victoria was munching on raw lemons and limes, salvaged from glass cups of lemonade, fully recovered from the daze by this point. There was also a dish full of unfinished aspic near her and a small stack of empty dishes away from all of them. Adrian had 3 glasses of lemonade, Kate had 1, all of them empty. Vici had 2, one was empty and the other half-empty, with the remaining lemonade slowly dwindling through periodic sips.

"You know, you two were right about the lemonade. It's so much richer in taste, and the temperature makes it so much better. I'd make my own soda if we weren't busy with work." - she admitted.

"I would be hella down if you change your mind. Man, the same 3 christmas tracks are making my ears bleed. Don't they have like a bigger variety, and not just a variety of "Jingle Bells" remixes?" - Adrian asked.

"No idea. I feel the same, but if that's the price I have to pay for being able to chew on Kate's bank account with no problems, then I am fine to take it. I don't know why are you so scared of a little sourness in your lives, this shit's gourmet."

"Like I said, I really don't mind as long as you enjoy it. Seeing you smile is invaluable to me." - Kate affirmed.

"You're too sweet. But yes, I love it. I know, I didn't actually like most of what I said I'd like to try out and you two had to eat it on my behalf, but the rest of it? Priceless. I am leaving the aspic for last, never ate anything better in my life. Speaking of, why are both of you giving me special treatment today?" - Adrian and Kate looked at eachother awkwardly, then slowly descended into a snort-laughter in a feedback loop of seeing eachothers' face expressions. Vici just looked at them both in confusion, still chomping on the lime insides attached to the shell while trying to get what they were laughing about. "I know you don't have any reason to buy my disposition since you've already got all of it. Is this some sort of a winter joke?" - her friends laughed harder. "Very well. "Oh, no. I was hoping I wouldn't have to hear the same worthless speech this year at least. Yea, our country is great, our enemies aren't, you don't like the leader of the other major party, you want everyone to think yours is the only one which would lead the Motherland to greatness even though the main parties have like 5 policy differences at most. Yes, daddy President, fill my ears with nothing I don't already know. Go ahead." - she said in exasperation.

"I am pretty sure the parties aren't nearly the same." - both Kate and Adrian were also bored before it even started, but not nearly as intensely. "They disagree on a lot of stuff. Economy, cosmetic cybernetics, internal immigration are the big ones."

"Whatever."

At some point, the President appeared. He looked like a middle-aged man in cosmetic brown glasses doing his best to look 20 with moderately long black hair and a short, dense beard. He also started making comparisons of the current wars to WW2 and the Turkish soldiers to nazis, at which point Victoria quickly pulled out her headphones, connected them to her phone and shut herself out of the rest of the speech with a random metal playlist she found online blasted on full volume. The screams were weird and music was generally repetitive and bad, yet she closed her eyes with a feeling of serenity and started taking long, deep breaths of various unfinished food. Eventually, she felt tapping on both sides, which caused her to quickly open her eyes and look left to right in alertness, but there were only her friends happily looking at her, with a hint of worry in Kate's eyes. She shortly realized the speech was over and it was already 2091. Vici paused the music and removed her headphones.

"Happy birthday and happy new year, sis!" - Kate clapped, sticking to the script.

"Yes!"

"Did you seriously not remember? I thought you were doing a bit earlier." - Kate asked.

After getting a hold of themselves, Vici grinned and nodded while Adrian said "Yies".

Eventually they all left for home together. There were ear-bursting fireworks and definitely not sober pedestrians walking around. Adrian was pretty sure he heard a car run into a road sign somewhere.

"Man, I have never been more full in my life. The cake at the end wasn't even that big, and yet it still wouldn't fit. Good thing we have the cleanup crew." - Victoria admitted, actually sounding slightly happy and carefree for once.

"Contact us again anytime." - Adrian smiled. He also sounded like he overate a little.

"Pristine party, K. Not as pristine as what we'll throw for you, but it will do."

As they needed to walk by a very hammered man, he turned towards them and stared, speaking something in Ethanolish. The group stopped for a moment, ready to draw their swords, but Vici's instinctive reaction was to instantly throw 3 pairs of shattering maracas at the drunkard in quick succession. He began comically walking backwards, trying to maintain balance, before collapsing between two cars parked on the road. The stranger tried to move his hands around to get up, but it was fruitless, so the group moved on.

Kate took a quick breath of surprise. "This confirms my suspicions. You are still in your prime, they don't have any reasons not to let us or you in particular do any actually dangerous tasks." - she said, agitated.

"What are you saying?" - Victoria was still in a state of cold focus from the encounter.

"I am saying, you don't need to do the same mundane activities you do all day. Let's go fucking hunt some organized criminals, together, all 3 of us. We can do this."

Adrian put his semi-stretched out fingers on his forehead and his heart rate noticeably spiked. "Oh no. Ohhhh no-no-no. I am gonna have to kill another man tonight. It's gonna be so bloody and they'll make sounds as they're dying… Oh man…" - he thought aloud anxiously.

"Are you okay? You said you handled it with no problems. Were you too afraid to tell me the truth? Am I giving you expectations so unreasonable that you need to lie to meet them?..." - Victoria asked sadly, putting a hand on his shoulder and staring into nothing at the same time.

"Vici, did you proceed with your idea?" - Kate asked judgmentally.

"Of course. I know I approached the matter delicately and gave him the best opportunity to absorb and tank it. So where did I fail?"

"Yes, but you \*did\* proceed with your idea. I told you, you'd be ruining his childhood. He might be smart and open-minded, but he is still a child. It's so wrong."

Vici looked at Kate without a face expression and started arguing back, complimenting words with hand motions. "Well, yes, which is why it's critical that he grows up sooner so he can unlock his true potential earlier and live the rest of his early years to the fullest. "The way I see it, you're just projecting your emotional numbness onto him so he can resemble you better, and it's not about strength but rather perfecting him as a soulmate." - Kate said a lot faster and slightly angrier than earlier.

Victoria rolled her eyes and sighed. "For fuck's sake, Kate. You know that would be out of character."

"But… \*I\* am the one to blame for this in the first place, ain't I? I've planted the virus, and it can't be blamed for wanting to multiply…" - Kate said sadly on normal speed before before turning away.

"No, Kate, we are not having this discussion again. Block these thoughts the fuck out. Adrian exhaled in relief. "Phew, thank fuck. And, I didn't lie to you about successfully processing what I did today. I actually thought it was under control, but it resurfaced."

She exhaled in relief. "In that case we'll just have to give you a bit more time. I am really glad we didn't fail just yet. Either way, Kate, you were right earlier. How do you feel about doing some vampire hunting?" - Vici asked.

"Amazing. Best possible choice. We also have no idea who they are and what kind of weirdos are they. Should be fun. I'll bring my garlic necklace and wooden stakes." - Kate replied with mild excitement. Or at least Victoria hoped it was.

"Wait, we're not… Doing this way past midnight, are we?" - Adrian asked worryingly.

"No. Even if I wanted to pull an all-nighter for some reason, we don't even know what vampires look like. I'll think of something which doesn't involve looking for a needle in a haystack. I doubt Kate would agree to just detain anyone who enters any apartment block past midnight either."

After getting home, the girls parted ways with Adrian for the night and went inside their apartment. "Wait, before you go. Don't think we've forgotten to give you your gifts for the occasion." - Kate's dad approached the girls with his left hand behind his back. "Don't think you're getting left out, Kate." - Kate was so hoping he would say that. "Likewise, we really appreciate your burning passion to learn and bring justice to people living in this city, and it was only right that you'd get something too." - her dad pulled out a black, lavish-looking pistol holster and gave it to her. As the girls walked into the latter's room, Kate took a seat on the bed and continued analyzing the present.

"I can't believe they'd give me something this valuable and fitting. It's so good." - she said quietly.

"Nah, it doesn't have to be. It's normal for people to receive gifts for New Year's Eve and birthdays."

"It \*is\* weird that the first big physical gifts they ever give us are so lavish. And are work-related." - Kate said as she placed the holster to the side.

"Also true. It makes sense for me, the resident workaholic, but you? No."

"Your loss. Either way, as I was saying. The big plan is for you to do nothing while me and Adrian infiltrate a virology lab and steal a prototype ultra-potent Corflaids sample and infect Murmansk before we run away. We flee, everyone dies, including the vampires, the end. What do you think?"

"And why would they keep a Corflaids strain in a lab? "Don't forget to sleep, girls!" - their step-mom requested from outside the room.

"Anyway, I am thinking me and Adrian go 'persuade' whoever is the local news guy to drop a fake story about a famous family moving into a very specific apartment block and saying that they haven't set up modern security countermeasures so it looks like a free target. "Clever. I am trained to overcome extreme discomfort like this and I could handle it if there's no other option, but he would die after the third door."
