After a few days of the usual mix of school, games, police work, pistol practice, pawning the rest of the spoils for chump change and Victoria pointing the flashlight in full force with red color at random apartment windows to keep her average amount of triggered panic attacks to at least 3 a day, Matt has finally granted her and Adrian the unlocked phones at around 19 hours as they were all sitting on a bench in a playground near the Starbloods' apartment block. Both Adrian and Vici took one of the phones each and checked if they were unlocked. Adrian got the fancy one, Vici got the one which didn't imply crippling insecurity for its former owner. They were unlocked with no problems, and the duo could even access the messengers and see plenty of unread messages from family and friends.

"Wow! You actually did it! That's so-" - Adrian was exclaiming before getting his cheek pinched by Victoria.

"Yep, it looks like it's all working. We can still hard reset the phones after we're done and pawn or claim them if the cops allow us to, right?" - she asked, composed.

"No-no-no. Like I said, you need to disconnect the devices from the manufacturer company account before then, which is nothing you need my help with. But after that, yea, it's safe, I double-checked for both of them." - Matt explained.

"Good. You've done us a great favor. And your country, I guess, but that's whatever." - Vici pulled out her own phone and opened the bank app, transferred Matt 2 thousand bears and showed him the successful transaction screen. "Keep the change from the previous transfers." - she said with a calm smile, as Adrian was aggressively rummaging through the messages of the old lady from earlier on the fancy phone, looking for something interesting.

"Really? Thanks! You know, even if I had to take a lot of sacrifices to make this happen this quick, it was really fun. Good luck with the investigation!" - he stood up, gave the duo a little wave and walked away.

"Bye!" - Adrian and Vici said back to back, kept waving at him for 10 seconds, and went back to their phones.

"Check the bank. Check the bank." - Vici said extremely quickly, and the duo began aggressively searching the home page for the bank apps. The one on Vici's phone was called Omnislavian National People's Bank of (or ONPB for short; Vici was familiar with the bank before and she found it using 2.5 nationalist naming prefixes as a hilarious overkill). She entered the app and got blocked by having to type in the pin code or use facial recognition to confirm identity to enter. "No, no… We were so close. Fuck." - she cursed in frustration.

"What's up? Pin code? Shit, got the same thing." - Adrian said before tabbing out of the app on his bank before it could capture his face with the automatically-activated frontal camera (for facial recognition) and pressed the screen against his leg. "I guess this is what he was talking about, with some apps having extra protection he can't crack. Don't tell me that's as far as we can get." - he said with disappointment.

"It is. There's no way we could still stay under the radar if we somehow seek out these guys, and even then, how would we find their locations? JF isn't \*that\* stupid to be tricked into helping us here." - Victoria sighed. "Fuck. Let's check their social media, we might find something interesting."

"I already found something. Check this out." - Adrian leant back and switched tabs to the messenger and began scrolling upwards to the start of a conversation as Vici also leant back to watch. It started on 11th of January, 2091, and it was between Elicia and some man named Andreas.

The conversation went as follows:

"mom, we need to talk.

you need to stop with this stupid cult, i know we have no other alternatives besides not doing anything, but look at how far you've changed since you started. these ""meds"" are making your health so much worse. when something brings more negative side effects than benefit, its a clear sign that you should stop, not double down. you used to be a psychiatrist, for christs sake.

kelly misses you and asks me every other day if we can see you sometime, but i cant in good sanity show her the you that youve become. i keep telling her that youre ok and that youre making progress, but the bubble will eventually pop and ill need to not drown in the sea of tears that comes out of her when that happens.

please, reconsider." - Andreas wrote.

Elicia always answered in messages in a hispanic, half pissed-off, half passive-aggressive, yet somehow super slow voice. Somehow it sounded even more elderly than normal. Naturally, Adrian put it on 2x playback speed to keep Victoria's attention from wandering off, and it was still barely enough. "Andreas, you're bothering me with your annoying constant attempts to dissuade me. They are very reputable professionals and they offer me the cheapest and most reliable help that exists anywhere in the world. One day you'll grow up and understand where I'm coming from, but for now, trust your mamma, hijo, trust your mamma. They are good people, and they only want what's best for me." - Elicia said.

"mom, i am 36 years old and i have 2 kids! why are you still playing that card? even misha knows your out of your mind and he doesn't even know you volunteer for them which is even worse and he just hit eighth grade. you are slowly and painfully killing yourself. think for a second. fun time is over. you already have liver cancer and hephaestus c or whatever, you dont need lung cancer too. if you die, it will be me who will need to arrange your funeral and calm down my family after what happened, and i have enough problems in my life already. stop, please. im scared. i dont want to lose you. you are making it harder and harder to sleep at night."

"Watch it, Andreas." - Elicia coughed in the voice message. "You can't speak to your mother like that. God doesn't like disobedient children, and no matter how big you and your family are, you will always be my son." - there was more in that voice message and the conversation in general, but it was more of the same depressing and frustrating shit.

Adrian stared into the ground somewhere emptily. "I can't believe this. This is what they're putting people and their families through for chump change."

"Oh, relax. It's just the usual consequences of tigers mauling off the victims' legs to prevent them from being able to run away. This old lady was old and desperate, she bit the hook and got reeled in. She couldn't follow the law of the jungle and became some clergymen's dinner." - Victoria explained, completely unbothered by anything she read, heard or said.

"I guess."

"Still trying to convince Adrian that might makes right is the main mechanism behind the way the world works?" - Kate's voice was heard from behind the bench.

Vici got startled, turned around to watch as Kate went in front of the bench, and shut off her stolen phone. "Oh, hi. How'd you notice us here?"

"I don't know, I was just heading towards a specific bench I was told to go to on the playground near our home and you happened to be sitting right here. Some coincidence, right?" - Kate said with post-ironic passive-aggression and shrugged, still standing to the forward right of the duo without sitting down.

"Alright, bro. You just \*love\* rubbing it in, don't you? Shitface." - Vici replied playfully.

Kate laughed. "Hey, Adrian."

"Yo." - he replied in a flat tone.

"You may aswell sit down." - Victoria signaled Kate to sit to the right of her in an empty space, which the latter did. "And again, I am not saying 'might makes right' summarizes all that ever happens in the world, but on a macro scale, for every Starshard of Murmansk, that is exactly what's going on. You're also a part of it too: you just use your agency to pick your prey while still tearing them in pieces with sharp, erect puma claws." - Vici shrugged. She said the last part mostly metaphorically, although Kate did sometimes get ordered to execute someone, which she always did with no remorse, thanks to the adults choosing the right kinda people and the right kinda framing for her. "That's probably not the right word." - she said quieter and faster while Kate was replying.

"Sure I am, but that principle implies leaving 'the weak' to die, which I don't do. Which not even you universally do. You could theoretically just blackmail me into doing your bidding with violence or abuse, but you're not doing that and we're still hanging despite the past. Not even \*you\* follow this law of the jungle, you edgelord." - Kate argued, not even sure at this rate whether to take Victoria seriously or not. The inappropriate usage of the word "erect" had gone completely unnoticed by her.

"Nuh uh, that's not how that works. Protecting those who matter is a vital part of the law, since power gives you the agency to do whatever the fuck you want, including protecting others." - Vici embraced Adrian with her left hand, as he continued staring into somewhere and thinking, and put her right one on Kate's shoulder at the same time, as the rest was too far to reach.

Kate took it as an invitation and promptly entered the group hug, leaning her head against Victoria's shoulder. After a few seconds of thinking, Kate finally replied, "...Wow. I can't believe- I don't know what to think anymore."

"Like I said, you're making conscious choices to prey on the ones who deserve it rather than anyone marked with a red dot on the minimap, and that's what makes you different, not that you're living within an entirely different ecosystem. If that's how you wanna have fun with life, who are we to stop you?" - Kate learnt by now that saying "fun has nothing to do with it" would fall on deaf ears, so she just didn't say anything. "Speaking of stopping, wanna see what we dug up?"

"It's wild. You gotta see this." - Adrian turned off the sleep mode on his stolen Svechka phone and handed it over to Kate after scrolling back to the start of the conversation from earlier.

Kate took the phone. "Oh… I shouldn't." - she tried to give Adrian the phone back, still admiring the craftsmanship as she held it out.

"I know what you're thinking. Blah, blah, violation of privacy, but trust me, you do \*not\* wanna miss this. If you still refuse, we'll just read it to you outloud." - Vici promised.

"Okay, okay, what is it…" - she began reading and listening. "Oh no…" - she said grievously after the first message. "Ugh, adults and their \*arrogance\*." - she commented with disgust after the first voice message.

"Yea, I prefer childish arrogance myself." - Vici replied.

After reading and listening a couple messages further, she stopped and handed Adrian the phone again, and this time he took it. "The adult fucks! They found a terminally-ill grandma with a large family and made her even more terminally-ill? How fucking evil even are Christians?" - she began angrily asking.

"That's what I'm asking." - Adrian agreed.

"As evil as everyone else. Never really dived deep into the subject, but apparently this whole scam started with snake oil and hypocritical dogma and was later abused constantly to extort material power through nonexistent divine leverage. Oh, and stomp women into the ground for a nice bonus, since the key to heaven was literally just a penis." - Victoria explained, not that she had a full picture. Kate was starting to get desensitized to Vici being gross from time to time. Thankfully, her line of work and her own complete desensitization only forced Kate to deal with occasional dirty mentions and comparisons like these and not actual… images. "Roman and medieval scammers worked a bit differently, but in the end their fishnets did their job. Don't think I actually asked, do \*you\* believe in anyone?" - she asked Adrian.

He thought for a bit. "Sort of, but not really. It's complicated. It was, anyway, but now that I think of it, doubt I'll be visiting church any time soon." - he replied calmly.

"I just can't believe this… How could a cult this evil become so mainstream? It's the world's most popular religion. How did we let that happen as a society?" - Kate asked, agitated.

"Never underestimate the power of human stupidity, Kate, and most of the world's mysteries would be solved for you." - Victoria noted. She actually had tons of fun discussing what she perceived as the history of scamming, even if the tone of her voice didn't show it.

"Did \*you\* ever believe, Vici?" - Adrian asked.

"Ha ha." - she replied with audible sass.

"I mean, I could have guessed the answer, but what's your story, if you have one? I reckon you do."

"Story? It's simple. If God is so benevolent and all-powerful, then no, he's fucking not. I am the living antithesis to that statement, as both a carrier and spreader of inhuman volumes of suffering. Case closed." - she grinned meta-ironically as Kate turned her head away.

"That's concise and straightforward."

"Yes… You know one thing which I \*do\* find extremely weird?" - she shifted her tone to a thoughtful one.

"Mmm?"

"If I wanted to make a medical scam, I'd sell the cheapest placebo I could buy as legitimate, overpowered medicine. Minimum investment, maximum profit, no traces of bad judgement calls in the victims' organisms. Kate, why are you gloomy again? Everything alright?" - she interrupted herself and looked at Kate.

"It's nothing. I'm alright. Anyway, makes sense." - Kate turned her head back towards her friends.

"You know what doesn't? The fact that Healing Paw sells cigarettes which require semi-advanced manufacturing and different compounds which require time and/or effort. And that they aren't harmless, but actively detrimental to your health."

"Huh." - Kate huh'd.

"Maybe it's luxury merchandise? The price markups on the cigs was pretty big." - Adrian brought up.

"They weren't that high. Maybe you're right and I have no idea what luxury means. Speaking of luxury, wanna take this Svechka phone off our hands, Kate? We figured it's something up your alley."

"It is, actually! It's so much better than mine, but also it was mugged off an old, terminally-ill lady. Not… something I am okay with." - Kate admitted.

"Oh, come on. JF said we could take anything and everything from them. It's legally ours, and after a hard reset, there will be no grandma's traces left." - Victoria bluffed. Well, more half-bluffed, since JF omitted any instructions in that regard, so it was perfectly plausible that they were given free reign in that regard as long as they got the job done.

Kate laughed. "You made that sound worse."

"Oops."

After recovering, Kate finally continued, "Either way, even if JF approved of it, it ain't right. And even if it didn't feel so goddamn weird, the association will never leave me alone, even if you snap the old lady out of existence." - she relapsed back into dying of laughter.

"Your loss, our gain." - Vici made a small shrug, smiling. It was still surreal to see all 3 of them hanging out together again.

They hung out for a while longer, eventually moving on to Kate and Vici's parents' bed to watch surreal Fruitnaz fan animation where characters were granted hilarious extra traits and ways of speech the original never had. At some point, Vici got a notification on her phone from her mother. There wasn't anyone else at home.

As she was pulling out her phone, Adrian got a notification too, and it was displayed right over the flatscreen. He paused the video playback on his phone and also opened the message, along with Kate.

"Is she for real? Past midnight? Into fucking Oroborovsk?" - Victoria remarked with apathy as she was replying something back to her step-mom. "Wait, you guys got the same message too?"

"Uh huh." - Kate affirmed in a laid-back tone. All 3 of them got a similar message from the same person. "Sounds like fun, plus Vasiliy is coming. You're not very happy about this, are you?"

"Yea, I'm gonna ask them to sweeten the deal on this one. Breaking my back by working past midnight for a big but not life-changing amount of money ain't worth it." - Adrian commented. Kate knew he wasn't at fault for feeling this way: it seemed like his smaller pool of energy wasn't something he could control.

"Good. They sure as shit better have some better motivation in store." - Victoria agreed.

After some time waiting for the reply, she received a reply and showed it to her friends with a smile. "Aw yea, this just gets better and better." - Kate said happily.

"Well, that's a big enough chip on the table to change my mind." - Adrian began disconnecting his phone from the screen in front of his friends and getting up to prepare for the journey as Victoria was affirming their participation.

The message which caused such a drastic 180-turn was "You'll get to skip school tomorrow ;) and everything else if you want".

The trio assumed new, more plain, clothes of cold colors, making every single one of them look like a pre-teen boy from a paid school, and forced to wear new moderately-thick winter clothes and hats, even Victoria, to her discontent. Adrian was allowed to keep wearing the funny pom-pom hat. Nobody took their pistols, since apparently they'd be given special ones for the job, and Vici could fit considerably less ice in her pockets.

Some Starblood's step-dad picked them up into his car and began driving them to the airport. The car was a spacious red jeep and it had much less company strapped on it than usual, only around 8 in total. Kate got the shotgun, as always.

"I look completely ridiculous, man. Our indoor getup is even worse. It's actually just negative drip." - Vici looked downwards on her clothes, smiling grievously. And the worst part is, she didn't even wear the gloves she was given.

"I heard from some 7th graders that other paid schools sometimes force students into dress codes like this one. Sounds awful." - Kate commented.

"Ugh. Literally 2084."

"Sorry, but you know-" - the middle-aged driver with a thick mustache said before getting spoken over.

"Yea, yea, important for the mission. I've been forcing myself to do shit I didn't like for years. I can handle being dressed like a normal person for a bit." - Victoria said with mild irritation and boredom. "If this counts as normal."

"At least they put the 'boy' in 'cowboy' for Kate's case." - Adrian said, admiring the beauty of late evening Murmansk. He wasn't bothered much by a change in dress code: he was used to looking like a generic goon, and looking like a generic 11 year old master of calculus, or whatever did the kids that age do in their expensive, soulless schools, wasn't that much worse.

"Oh, shut up." - Kate chuckled. "Just because I always wear boyish clothes doesn't mean I like looking like a loser with better physics grades than personality.

They eventually got to the airport, met up with a bunch of G-men in sunglasses and minimalistic black coats, and embarked on a long walk through the airport halls. Vici could've sworn the airport was notoriously dirty last time she checked, but now it was almost perfectly clean for some reason.

The Starshard group has eventually arrived near a gold-painted private jet. Unlike commercial or cargo planes, this one was only a few alligators long, but it wasn't as compact as most fighter jets either.

"That's the chariot that'll take you to Oroborovsk. One of our friends from the FBS shall explain you the details. Good luck on the mission, and make your country proud!" - the car's driver from earlier said, performing the standard Omnislavian salute of putting his right fist against the temple. FBS, or Federal Bureau of Security, was "pretty much more serious countrywide police", as it was described, and it was still unofficially insubordinate to Fist of Liberty. \*used to be mind of liberty aka MOL here, idk why, doublecheck if it makes sense\*

Kate and Vasiliy saluted him back and went inside, while Vici and Adrian didn't salute back. "Yea, we got it." - she said and went inside along with everyone else along with some bald G-man. She and Adrian never saluted the adults except when it was required to make it subtly clear that she's fueled by money, not nationalism. It was unclear if that changed anything at all on the adults' end.

Everyone took off their coats, revealing Vasiliy also dressed equally as lame as everyone else, while the FBS agent just wore a business suit under the coat. There was a semi-small table with 4 seats around it, all 4 occupied by the Starshards, plus another smaller table with 2 seats surrounding it, one of which the FBS agent sat on. Kate and Adrian got seats near the windows. Everyone put their phones in flight mode, and the plane took off shortly after.

After a while of admiring the view, the adult in the plane asked:

"Alright. Let me brief you on your mission. How much do you know already?" - his tone was a lot colder and more brutish than the children were used to when dealing with adults, even in the lab.

"Something about a sting operation revealing the cigs in Murmansk being supplied by a certain textile factory in Oroborovsk, which we need to infiltrate. And also that the guy in charge of the textile company we're infiltrating being the Healing Paw's biggest donor by a mile, so if the location isn't a decoy, it means the end for both the organization and the CEO of the textile company." - Victoria explained.

"Correct. While the drive you took from the bakery wasn't sufficient enough to determine the supplier, the retrieved data was analyzed by JF, more fronts were discovered, a tracker was put on one of the supplying trucks and your destination was discovered." - the man explained was looking at the children blankly. That emotionless, soulless tone of speech was something only Vici was capable of.

"Do you FBS boys also rely on JF in your investigations like we do?" - Vasil asked. Kate was still mesmerized by the view outside the window, although she was still paying attention to the briefing just fine.

His question was completely ignored. "After we land, I can take you a couple of bus stops away from your destination, leaving you to cover the rest of the way on foot, or I can drop you off near an apartment block on the way where you can borrow a car from one of the sleeping citizens."

"Yes! Option two! I always wanted to stealy wheely an automobiley!" - Vasil exclaimed in excitement.

"Vasil!" - Kate said, her smile ruining her attempt at making a judgemental tone.

Adrian began laughing, Victoria began wheezing. "I knew you had it in you!" - she said finally. Vasil was also wearing this mask of a protector of order and justice, and seeing him show his true colors was quite satisfying.

After a while of staring at the Starshards with an exasperated face that seemed to scream "I want to go full Master Skywalker on all of you" and waiting for them to finish laughing their asses off and look back at him, he finally continued, "Your task is to break into the factory and acquire proof of toxic cigarettes and/or food being manufactured, then send it to JF, get out and let us do the rest. Adrian's psychic vision should help locate the secret facility if it's inside, underneath or otherwise connected to the factory. Search for signatures of tons of animals in one room. Also, try to minimize the casualties, especially if the guards or workers aren't aware of the cult activity, but don't hesitate to neutralize anyone who stands in your way or puts you in danger. You shall be outfitted with cameras on your necks to record everything you see, the building architecture plan with the security camera locations and silenced pistols. Note that they're still reasonably loud and neutralizing targets or disabling cameras even with it would still put you on a timer before the factory security is alerted."

"Are the guards armored or can we shoot them in the head twice and be done?" - Vici asked thoughtfully. Everyone else just listened without a word.

"Standard security guards are only protected with 9mm pneumatic pistols and a flak vest, but the ones guarding the secret facility might have stolen military-grade equipment or even combat androids if you're unlucky. Exercise caution."

Adrian's and Vasil's eyes widened. "Androids, great. I always wanted to die before puberty, guess now's my chance." - Victoria remarked cynically. The actual wars were dominated by various types of combat androids due to their endurance, super-intelligence, obedience, cost-efficiency… Even the cheap, expendable models were much better than humans in almost every aspect when it came to direct warfare, and according to an educational video, they turned the mechanics of war completely upside down when they first became widespread. Humans, even non-cyborgs, were still used on the battlefield plentifully, though.

"Oh, come on, Gal Capone. We got this. We don't even need to destroy any of them, just record that shit and leave." - Kate tried to reassure her.

"You don't understand. We've watched a video about them, these aren't your stupid bolt buckets or clankers from games, they're 5 times as hypervigilant as I am, they have real-life aimbot, they have infinite morale, and they're resistant even to medium caliber bullets, so 9mm bullets should bounce off like rubber." - Victoria turned to Kate and began explaining with mild frustration. She also wanted to comment on how much she loved the nickname, but it'd make the rest of what she wanted to say feel less serious.

"Yep, can confirm. They fuck, nothing she just said was a hyperbole." - Adrian nodded with an awkward face. "You \*do\* have a plan for us not to instantly die, right? I doubt even a threat like this is enough to intimidate you into submission."

"Well, yea, submission doesn't exactly pay well. We just need a perfect plan with all the failsafes so we can run if we see one, or to somehow blind the fucker with the flashlight if it's just one and not 20 horny misanthropic death robots." - Vici thought aloud, adamant to get the job done.

"I can't believe no matter what we do and what direction life takes us, some things just don't change." - Kate commented, smiling. "I've got a plan, Adrian!" - she said in a proper cowboy accent.

"You've always got a plan!" - Adrian responded, also in a cowboy accent. It has improved vastly since last time.

Kate and Adrian looked at Vasil in suspense. "This is a good one." - joy was written all over Kate's face when he finally said it with an appropriate accent.

"If mocking my unsophisticated choice of words is something you need to decompress, go ahead. Just make sure you focus on the job when we arrive. Matter of life or death, you know." - Victoria requested in a mildly affectionate tone. "Anyway, stoic suit bro, do you have the building plans with the cameras?" - she asked the FBS agent.

"They should have sent it to you on the way to the airport. Check your messages." - the FBS agent answered.

The group swiftly assembled the plan before the plane eventually reached Oroborovsk's airspace.

"We're close." - Adrian observed.

"Sounds about right. Can only see the corners from this angle, what does the famous former Saint Peter's City AKA Lenin's City look like?" - Vici asked.

"It looks like Moscow, but less shittier and less overwhelming. Still looks like shit." - indeed, Oroborovsk was closer to American megapoli from media in terms of the amount of ad billboards.

"If I was the first president of Omnislavia, I would sure as shit be offended by having a city like that named after me." - Victoria smiled.

"I kind of liked Moscow, honestly. The disasterous sensory overload from all the flashing ads was delightful." - Vasil commented with closed eyes. He sounded mildly sleep-deprived at this point.

Victoria made a really gross comparison of central Moscow's visuals to something else. "Vici, sweetie, you forgot about Kate's virgin ears!" - Adrian exclaimed, mostly laughing from the awkwardness, not the comparison itself, his laughter masking his sleepiness. Vici made an awkward face and shut her mouth with her right palm.

"Whoa, whoa! Is that what you were talking about?" - Vasil asked Kate, mildly shocked and amused.

Kate nodded in response with an awkward smile. "It's usually a lot more moderate, it's not often this…" - Kate chuckled awkwardly, with her sleep deprivation making the chuckle even more awkward. "...nasty. She's a special lady."

"Not sure if I qualify as a lady. I guess the minimalistic definition applies." - Victoria commented in a sarcastic tone, even though she was genuine.

The gang landed and traversed the loud, crowded, dirty and generally disgusting airport along with the FBS tough guy, with Adrian, Kate and Vasil chugging 20 bcaps of not-espresso, given how excessive espresso was with near-zero tolerance for Adrian that one time and Vasil that another time. After all 5 of them reached the parking lot, the Starshards entered a fully black car without any markings to drive them halfway along to the destination as planned. "Good luck. Don't forget to report your progress to JB." - the agent told the children before turning around and walking away. Adrian gave him a wave, Vasil gave him a nod and ordered the car to start driving. The streets of Oroborovsk were just like in Murmansk, but more populated, dirty and with more lights from ads everywhere, and the roads were actually noticeably easier to traverse due to less traffic and better roads.

"Man, it feels weird to actually come visit Oroborovsk after all this time. Maybe I should visit one of my friends from here after all of this is over." - Adrian commented as he got back to his phone again, inviting his dating app prey to a more loosely moderated social media site. GoldMine was unfortunately very intolerant and prejudiced to honest scammers like him and Vici, so they needed to manipulate and rob their victims outside of the automod's vigilant metaphorical eye.

"Yea, sounds like a great plan. We could go together on a double d- you know." - Victoria commented with sass, looking at the image of the factory on her phone.

"What are you guys talking about? Do you wanna meet up with some friends from games after this?" - Vasil asked curiously.

"Exactly. We've been making lots of new friends." - Vici falsely affirmed in a patronizing tone.

"Oh, sweet. Kate, why do you look like they're using code for something else?"

Kate made a straight face and put her arms behind her neck. "I don't know what you're talking about. They're clearly making new friends from gaming, that's all there is to it."

Adrian couldn't contain it anymore and snort-laughed. Victoria kept smiling, despite the humor of the situation. "Okay, I guess this is some sort of inside joke I'm not getting." - Vasil disengaged from the conversation calmly.

"Oh, yea. I am an expert in… inside… jokes..." - he burst back into laughter as he tried to say the last word, even dragging Vici along with him to laugh even harder than him. Kate couldn't help but laugh a little too after getting it, despite her best efforts to suppress her own laughter due to embarrassment. Vasil just looked at all of them with confusion, trying to understand the context in vain.

When the car arrived near some random apartment block, the mission crew went outside, and the car drove away on its own back to the airport. Here the darkness of nighttime Oroborovsk was far more noticeable, even though you could still see everything well enough.

"Well, what do you guys think? Car colored in ad vomit, car colored with ad vomit, big car colored with ad vomit, or car colored with ad vomit." - Kate pointed at the options of autos to grand theft with a smug smile.

"Big car colored with ad vomit, I guess. At least the insides aren't covered in it. It's a calamity, honestly. They took beautiful 20th century machinery and turned it into abominable ad vomit, great term, Kate. Race cars in the past had some, sure, but holy \*fuck\*, nowadays it got even worse." - Vasil ranted, setting up a navigator app to guide him from the dark nowhere to the target factory.

"Fun and beauty in life are overrated, anyway." - Victoria said before proceeding to embrace Adrian for no reason in particular, as if the cynical sarcasm in the sentence wasn't obvious enough.

Vasil then began unlocking the target jeep with some unusual tools as everyone walked around aimlessly and waited for him, not paying attention to the process. He finally got in, not turning on any of the electronics in the car, positioned his phone with the navigator on the car control panel \*verify wording\* and unlocked the doors to the side. "Get in." - he said in a stereotypically masculine tone, barely resisting the urge to honk just because he could. As everyone got in, he continued, "Turns out, I needed to start this one in fully analog mode so there's no logs or anything. Meaning, I'm gonna need to manually drive it to our destination." - Victoria, Adrian and Kate all buckled up one by one in that order, despite never doing that previously due to nobody being there to remind them (and due to road accidents becoming much less common with the standardization of self-driving cars). "Wow. Waaaaaaaaow." - he said before buckling up aswell.

Despite everyone's mild worries, the "borrowed" group arrived near the destination completely unscathed, with Vasil parking the car by the side of the road opposite of the factory in an inappropriate place. Vici and Brian hopped hopped onto the yacht's aft, Brian shot some guy blindly swimming in the water surrounding the yacht with a silenced assault rifle, knowing it couldn't have been a hostage as they were all in the engine room according to intel. As per the plan, the military opened the big door to the maintenence section remotely.
The section of the maintenance room had a panicking activist right outside the worst of the smoke, prepared to shoot or boot. "Hit the guy in front with your new ability, I wanna try something." - Victoria told Brian. After he did his part and she saw how the man got on his knees and dropped the riflr from the shock of such a substance entering his brain, she sprinted out of the fog to quickly get behind him and handcuff him before he turned into a hallucination zombie. Despite Victoria's lacking physical strength due to reliance on ice in combat, she had enough force in her arms to get his arms behind his back and cuff them. She could also see the terrorist clearly without fog now: it was a very young adult wearing light-brown camo with a bulletproof vest on top of it, and also a helmet with a mismatching white camo pattern. She could also see her and Brian's clothes were covered in dark gray from smoke. 
"Nice." - Brian observed, keeping an eye out for anyone else. The maintenance section had a extra rooms in it, and also two thin hallways ahead which led to the engine room where the hostages were held.
"I am sorry, Blood Pony of Zanumbia. I plead guilty for mouse murder and pug apologism." - the man's hallucinations kicked in, and the signature prismatic color entered his eyes. He went properly down on his knees, with his hallucination adapting to him being physically restrained. Victoria started hearing some weird mechanical noises behind her, which in reality were just the military closing the door as the terrorist leader tried to open it back up to be able to send reinforcements when the smoke dissipated.
Brian pulled up his phone to see footage from inside the engine room, recorded by a stealthy robot. "Check this out." - he showed Vici the footage. There were 6 enemy fighters, all wearing helmets with ear protection and uniforms with similarly mismatched camo patterns, sitting behind cover and preparing to ambush anyone who came near, additionally placing hostages they were using in front of their cover to give the strategy an additional human shield element. Bezdon and Lumina were simply lying horizontally face upwards with bags on their faces. 
"I don't know! I don't know anything about that, Miss Margaret Snatcher! I swear, I didn't do it!" - the captured terrorist shouted delusionally, ruining the moment's tension.
"Man, I missed the rainbow gas zombies." - Vici remarked. "They're clearly well-trained, it's an elite tower defense layout they got going. Couldn't have done too much better myself."
"How the hell are we to penetrate this? The hostages are there so we can't rainbow gas. The moment we peek out, we're dead. There's also 6 of them, so no decoys would work." - Brian thought aloud.
"I revoke my allegiance to soup and go all vegan! I will never eat another flower with flesh!" - Vici's hostage undercut tension again with his psychobabble. 
"There's two passages, right? I might have something. Go to the door to the left hallway and hide to its right. When you hear them react to my presence, count 10... No, 8 seconds and blast a couple of them with your rainbow gas gusts, then hide again. Then we wait 8 more seconds and use ensuing confusion to take care of the rest and hope that the guys you hit somehow won't reengage with no issues. You can fire your new spell in quick succession, right?" 
"Yea, I can charge it up to fire two in a row, and no, it's statistically unlikely for them to just swap textures inside their eyes and continue holding the chokepoint like nothing happened." - Brian confirmed. "Let's do this, whatever you have in mind."
"Fighting ice with ice is what I have in mind." - Victoria said before proceeding to force the hostage to stand up and move towards the hallway to the right. Again, she wasn't very strong, so it took a while, and eventually they reached the door. Vici opened the door with her hand and did a peek-a-boo by using the hostage as a decoy.
"Hold your fire! Hold your-" - a protestor started saying loudly before being interrupted by gunshot spread, though none of the bullets actually hit. All hostages started screaming in pain from someone firing a gun inside a building with no silencer. It was a phenomenon which caused the sound's ricochet to amplify already loud volume of gunshots, especially assault rifles. There was some loud chatter going on between the fighters inside, but Vici couldn't hear what exactly was being said, and she forgot that her bionic ears specifically had a function to separate target incoming information from the noise that blocked it out until it was too late. Thankfully, due to the helmets the duo were wearing having similar properties to bionic ears, neither Victoria nor Brian suffered any serious damage from the sound. 
Victoria kept having the hostage peeking out from behind the door, though eventually he overpowered her and ran through the doorway to start moving around in place erratically, which inside of his mind looked like he was going through a real-life bullet hell as punishment for his also entirely fictional crimes. Brian took the ongoing commotion as a sign everything was going all according to Vici's plan, then he peeked out from his door after counting up to 8 and fired a small rainbow gas gust at each of the two gunmen, then went behind cover to count 8 more seconds. Victoria has decided not to deviate from the plan, assuming Brian would do what was planned, and roughly counted 18 seconds from the moment the screaming started. When Brian peeked out, he was surprised to find one of the terrorists he landed a hit on to be shooting hostages while screaming something, while the other was instead shooting his allies and the ceiling a little before getting put out of his misery by an ally's headshot. Regardless, the plan worked successfully and every single fighter in the room except the handcuffed one Vici used as a human shield was killed without a scratch, minus the fact that pretty much every single hostage's ears were annihilated. Everyone (again, pretty much) laid down in pain with blood pouring out of everyone's ears, and if that wasn't enough, a tied-down lady in a sparkly red dress was killed by a stray gunshot and two more hostages had bullet wounds in them. The surviving terrorist Victoria used as a human shield was completely unbothered by the gruesomeness of it all, continuing to enjoy his rainbow gas trip and spouting psychotic nonsense occasionally. Brian kept an eye out for him. 
"Thank you, gentlemen. Despite all the blood, you've actually done a great job, considering I am completely unharmed. Mind untying me?" - a middle-aged man in a blue bathrobe sitting against a wall requested. He also had a gilded bionic arm stylized in the style of the Infinity Gauntlet and a prosthetic lower jaw, also gilded and covered in gemstones. And if that wasn't enough, he also had bionic LED hair programmed to look golden and glitter. I would list more, but at this point you get the idea. 
Victoria completely ignored the request and went to free the captured Starbloods without saying a word, knowing what would come next would be a little awkward. "Yes, sir." - Brian agreed with the kind of tone he'd use when someone offered him well-seasoned trout and went to obey the request. 
"Shame about Natalia. She gave the best blowjobs." - the man remarked.
Frowning at the implications of the remark, Victoria said nothing and cut the ropes on Lumina with an ice dagger she made on the spot, removing the bag over her eyes and the gag in her mouth. They exchanged an uncomfortable eye contact, trying not to look in eachother's direction and being on guard for the other suddenly attacking. This was also the reason Vici picked to untie Bezdon second, so him being happy to see her would ease the tense atmosphere. When she similarly untied Bezdon and he saw her, he said:
"Vicci? Fuuuuck, I can't believe they sent *you*. This was supposed to be my playground where I could show them I can kick ass. Now the whole mission will be piss easy and unrewarding. Man." - he said with severe disappointment in his voice, plus a subtle undertone of boredom Vici knew Bezdon well enough to detect. As Lumina stood still to face away in emptiness, she felt the exact same thing. 
Victoria sighed. "Help me put on oxygen masks on everyone in the room. Important for the mission." - she said with the same sort of emotionless, flat tone she has not used in a while, handing Bezdon 5 breathing masks. 
"I am happy to see you though, even though the adults robbed me of an opportunity to have some real fun." - he gave her a friendly double tap on the shoulder with a black tentacle sprouting from his back.
"Thanks, likewise." - Victoria felt a little better, though her tone was still flat and morose.
"Why the masks? Do I have to?" - the rich man in a towel asked.
"Unless you have a bionic upper breathing system with an oxygen filter, yea." - Brian said, putting on masks on the hostages at the same time. All Starbloods in the room were busy doinh the same, except Lumina, who felt too weird to help, all the while Vici also felt too awkward to offer her to help too. By now, the hostages without bionic ears have recovered from the immediate pain shock and some even expressed their mental at what happened in strained, meak voices. Then again, even by a few years later none of them would have completely recovered. 
"I do. Still, what are you kids trying to do?"
"A war crime Kaizer Wilhelm the Second would approve. Für Gott, König und Vaterland, motherfucka!" - he exclaimed. 
After the Starbloods were done, Brian entered a side room of the maintenance section from one of the hallways leading to the engine room all the while other Starshards stood and watched. He climbed a table after gently shoving aside a keyboard on it, opened the vent above the table and started breathing rainbow fumes on it. He kept going for a while, infecting the ventilation system of the entire yacht with his acid trip fumes, successfully affecting most of the fighers on the yacht. Brian then descended down and went back outside to the hallway, hyperventilating. "I feel so tired, I don't think I can go on. I think I hit a limit of how much rainbow gas I could produce. The gas should have affected most of the ship, giving you a smooth sailing until the rest of the fighters are cleared out. I'll chill with the hostages. Go." - he said.
"Please check on my fiancé. Make sure she is okay!" - the rich man asked. 
"She's probably delighted, honestly." - Victoria comments. 
"Wait, what do you mean?" 
"Ugh." - her previous line was a failed attempt at implying the fiancé would have loved being separated from the man. Vici decided not to bite the hand that feeds and move on. "You've seen the yacht's blueprints, right, Bez?" - she asked.
"Yep." - Bezdon said, his usual gleeful voice being gone.
"Cool."
When Victoria, Lumina and Bezdon approached the maintenance section door, Lumina turned on her searing hot lightsaber, to which Bezdon had to use one of his void tentacles to gently push her right arm downward a little. "Whoa there, this is a yacht of an Omnislavian magnate. We were told to minimize collateral damage. We can just get it open remotely."
"Uh huh." - Lumina finally said something.
There were two fighters standing outside the door, facing assault rifles at the maintenence door as it was opened remotely by the military. However, when the door opened, the fighterd were shocked by a terrifying sight of Bezdon using each of the four pairs of tentacles he had to hold an assault rifle each, plus another in his hands, with Lumina and Victoria standing near him on opposide sides. 
"He-he-he, howdy." - he said before proceeding to kill all three of them at once with his quintuple-wielded assault rifles. It was clear by the way he held each of them and by how relatively little recoil there was that he had a decent amount of practice with this loadout. In case you're wondering where did he get his rifles, he looted them off of the guys Brian and Victoria killed earlier along with some of their ammo, though Vici assumed it was just loot goblin behavior. 
"I am never doing that again, that was terrifying." - Victoria commented. "Also, holy fuck you've got aura."
"I know, right? Where is she going?" - Bezdon asked in confusion as Lumina used the opportunity to regrow her white wings of light to fly out of the interior. She then curved towards the left while staying near the water and decapitated a terrorist *fix wording* unsuccessfully trying to get her in his sights from near the fence of the yacht's second deck. In the same dash, she turned off the lightsaber, flew up towards a rainbow-eyed guy standing on the yacht's very top and made a mid-air frontflip before pushing him off to the water with a horse-style kick using both of her feet, then hid from the enemy gunfire by hiding on the same roof. At the same time, after hearing the commotion, Victoria and Bezdon ascended to the first deck to take advantage of the disorientation Lumina's maneuver caused to effortlessly kill every fighter in there. Granted, most of them were claimed by Bezdon's guns, but Victoria managed to hit one with a well-aimed ice spear, penetrating his bulletproof vest and miraculously hitting the heart as he was a thirdway into raising his own gun. It was unfortunate for him that "bulletproof" didn't mean "ice spear prooof", though in practice it didn't even mean it was impervious even to bullets either.
When Bezdon and Victoria started ascending to the second topmost deck, Bezdon suddenly said:
"Get down! They're expecting us."
Victoria paused, beginning to assemble a huge greatshield from ice. "How did you even know?"
"My tentacles can see. Or, rather, I can see through them."
"Someone nerf this man, he is too powerful.' - she commented with an inappropriately flat tone as she was focused on preparing the ice shield for a play. When she was finished, she held the shield up and went up the stairs while facing backwards. As expected, her shield was hit by intense gunfire from the 9 enemy gunmen, and as expected, the shield handled it just fine despite minor knockback and shards of it flying to the sides. Enduring the firing squad, Vici stepped forward, shapeshifted an ice ball from the redundant corner of the shield and launched it at an activist via cryokinesis, shattering it mid-air as always. Except this time instead of painful yet non-lethal shards the ball was shattered into a wide spread of sharp bullets, more than enough to kill like a real bullet, though not very good against standard infantry armor. As she repeated the process with others with Bezdon helping a little while staying almost entirely in cover, Lumina capitalized on the commotion by orchestrating a move to slice through three enemies at the same time with a single dash, and while she narrowly missed the first, the other two targets were split in two. She tried to correct her miscalculation after breaking her speed against the floor by shooting the remaining terrorist on the deck with laser eyes, but they unfortunately only had enough firepower to disorient the man from pain of the burns rather than kill. After another attempt to do the same, Victoria's shotgun of doom reached the man and finished him off.
"Bez, come on up before someone comes out of the interior and shoots you." - Vici warned Bezdon.
"That was beautiful. I take it back, this is wonderful." - Bezdon commented as he was going up, high on the euphoria of righteous slaughter.
"Reminds me of how we once fought off 2 full-sized blocks at the same time and won. I won 500 tokens from that, I still remember the fleeting joy."
"This is so much better. In the lab we had to avoid killing and just beat people to pain shock, but now, look at them all and their giant pools of blood! They all had families, parents, ambitions, traits, and we just destroyed them all in a single minute." - Bezdon pointed at Lumina's victims with his right arm. "Look at how Lumina's lightsaber fried these two guys as it cut through them! You could never get anything this cool in the lab." - he kept pointing out, drowning in joy.
"Eh, don't get your obsession with corpses, but I have to admit..." - Vici was interrupted. 
"Would you come on already!? We're not finished yet!" - Lumina finally snapped at the two. 
Meanwhile in the captain's chamber, a teenage girl in a light coat was tied up to a chair. She looked unbothered by her position, and did not try to break free. *give her visual traits matching sofia's* Two fighters stood near the yacht controls with tense body expressions. Both had their faces obscured by full camo helmets.
"Hello? 27, what's the situation with the hostages?" - the one wearing an Order of Suvorov on his chest said with a walkie talkie in his hand. If you're wondering how he obtained one, don't think about it. Thinking is bad for you. 
"Command, this is 27. There were two soldiers trying to recapture the hostages. We ambushed them, one of them is dead, the other has joined the hostages. We're all clear." - the voice answered in a masculine voice. 
"Roger that. Hold your position." - the commander said, turning off the walkie talkie. "So that confirms it. One of the three cleaving through the ship is a freed hostage. We might have lost our only leverage. Any thoughts for the best way for us to surrender? Doesn’t look like there's any way we'll be returning from this." - he commented, facing the other fighter. In case you didn't get what just happened, the voice on the other side was a military spiderbot impersonating a now-dead protestor. The voice wasn't wrong, but the evidence it presented obviously contradicted reality. 
"Alright, that's far enough." - the other fighter with an Order of Lenin on his chest drew his sidearm and shot the commander in the heart 4 times even before he finished the line. He then ripped the Order of Suvorov from his former boss's chest, cleaned it up with a napkin and put it on his own chest. His equipment protected him from the ear damage from the gunfire. 
"Holy shit! You iced him while he was looking right at you. Your so-called childhood best friend! This is crazy, I'm gonna tell all my friends about this once this is over." - the teenage girl commented with an amused grin on her face, unbothered both by 140 decibels of gunfire and the fact that she just witnessed an internal coup happen in front of her.
The new commander finished putting the corpse sitting against a wall and aimed his assault rifle at the girl. "One word to the crew about this and it will be your last."
She shrugged. "I am not a threat to you. I don't have a horse in this race. I just wanna see how this ends. Speaking of, how do you plan on reaching Britain without any hostages to use for blackmailing the military into inaction?"
"You're plenty enough." - the man commander put the rifle behind his back.
"Okay. And what if the 'three superhero dwarves' as you called them reach us here?"
"They won't. There's only three of them, and they're- hmm." - the fighter caught himself before he spoiled the following. 
In the meantime, Victoria, Lumina and Bezdon kept moving through the lavish interior rooms of the yacht and searching for the yacht owner's fiancee. The trio was complete overkill for the threat level, with Bezdon's tentacles being more than enough to do all the work all the while the young ladies stayed behind to watch the flanks. Seeing so many expensive trinkets all around, Victoria really wanted to swipe a few and pawn them, but resisted the inner kleptomaniac. Even if she could "accidentally" turn off the body camera, which she couldn't think of a way to do inconspicuously enough, there was no way a military spy drone wasn't currently watching their every move. Suddenly, after another spree of gunshots Bezdon made an alarmed exhale and hid to the side of an open doorway. Black goo was leaking through one of his tentacles.
"Hello and welcome to your daily OUTMACHED BY DESTRUCTIVE POWER OF RED TALON! Please proceed through the doorway TO GET FILLED WITH BULLETS in an orderly fashion." - a voice from behind the doorway said, using a perfectly human-like feminine voice, occasionally saying some parts of the line in a brutal and masculine voice instead, seamlessly transitioning from one voice to another. All 3 Starbloods were visually alarmed. And yes, the fighter group was called the Red Talon all along.
"You heard that, right?" - Bezdon asked Vici with unusual tension in his voice, even if he kept the usual composure.
"Yup." - she replied, her internal tension skyrocketing. This just went from an average risk operation to a matter of life and death. "It had to happen eventually."
"We advise you to find another way in or leave the mission. Our intel suggested nothing about androids." - the Starbloods heard an unknown, clearly military-affiliated masculine voice say to their ears through their equipment. 
"Not so tough now, are you, child Solid Snake wannabes? If you think I am punished for killing children on the battlefield, let me enlighten you: WE GET TWICE THE DOPAMINE FOR KILLING CHILDREN." - the android in the room taunted them, saying the first sentence with a cheery masculine narrator voice, the first half of second with the feminine voice from earlier and the second half with something an evil overlord video game final boss would have. And yes, any non-primitive AI has reward and punishment systems, just like a human brain, and no, it's generally a very bad idea to let them have any control whatsoever over these systems. Unsurprisingly, the taunt backfired by making Bezdon smile gleefully in response instead, and the girls didn't react at all. 
"Ignore its taunting. There is no shame in fleeing a fight you can't win unless we specifically tell you otherwise." - the military-affiliated voice continued. It might not have done much now, but this strategy was disproportionately effective considering pretty much anyone even remotely familiar with modern warfare was well aware of it. 
"Let's see if the unwinnable part is true." - Vici said, constructing something big from ice in preparation for a move. 
Bezdon used the opportunity to peek out with his gun and try to kill the android, but Vici's earlier description of combat androids was not an overexagerration, and as soon as the tentacles peeked out, the high-caliber bullets of the android's gun flung the assault rifle in Bezdon's tentacles into the corner and caused more goo to pour out of his tentacles. He still had 5 tentacles and 3 assault rifles undamaged, though. "That was dumb." - he commented, remembering that android reaction speed was way better than what any human could muster. He then showed Vici a gesture of crossed pinky and ringfinger, indicating that he is about to say something knowingly false to disorient the enemy with verbal disinformation presented as real tactical discussion. "So how do we even run away? We might be pinned down here." - he had no idea what exactly was her plan or how high were her chances of survival, but he knew she was way better at quick tactical thinking than any human he knew, and he knew she wasn't the kinda person to sacrifice herself in battle. Lumina just stood to the side, unable (and partly unwilling) to add anything, focusing on monitoring the corridors for reinforcements.
"I say we throw a smoke bomb and hope for the best. We're fucked." - Victoria replied, also showing the pinky and ringfinger crossed gesture for a moment while preparing two ice greatshields. She knew that an NCAI, which felt no pain and was made of metal, couldn't be defeated with ice shards, and even an ice spear would have barely made a dent. And yet, she did do her homework for this exact situation. "Command, how many androids are there in the next room?" - she whispered.
"One." - the same voice from earlier replied through her's equipment.
"If I die, tell the gang I died happily." - Victoria said before sprinting through the doorway while holding up two thick ice greatshields. The android attempted to shoot at the bottom to hit her legs, but failed to penetrate it, allowing her to get close to the robot, sandwich it between the ice shields and shapeshift the ice from the shields into a proper ice shell to encase the android in it, rendering it functionally inact. She considered melting the inside of the ice shell to fry the android's circuits with water (assuming it wasn't waterproofed), but felt like the military would have appreciated a recaptured android in mint condition. The android tried to say something, but only distorted noises of wildly varying pitch and volume were audible. Victoria beckoned Bezdon to come in, who in turn gestured Lumina to follow him. 
"Fight you can't win my ass. Adults are way too careful, man, this is easy." - he commented, giving his arms a little adrenalized shake.
"It's still androids. Can't say much with this guy still alive and listening, but they're AGI's. The next one will expect this as our move, unless this one lacks even the basic android to android communication, and it doesn't look like it." - Victoria rounded up the android's ice shell to take the most obviously excessive parts of it back, avoiding taking too much to prevent the android from suddenly breaking free and killing all 3 operatives, and constructed thick front-only leg armor from the salvaged ice. She couldn't say it outloud, but her ice supply was two thirds to depletion, and another ice sandwich trick like that would have left her with barely enough to defend herself against humans. She also tried to find a large water bottle or sink nearby to refill her ice reserves, but all she could find was wine and vodka. It still helped refill the supply by ~5%.

One evening, while Adrian was staying up late to track down and arrest a local man who took a book from a library without paying, Vici was at home, preparing snacks to watch revisionist history documentaries all on her own. When passing by Kate who was typing something with a frustrated expression, Vici offered her:

"Hey, want some dried apples? Heard-" - that they were your favorite, she wanted to say.

"No! I'm busy!" - Kate replied with intense frustration in her voice. It wasn't very common she was seen in a state like this.

"Just asking. Jeez, isn't the whole privilege of being a Starshard or even just a police intern that you get an unlimited supply of people to unleash your repressed anger on?" - Victoria started walking away.

"Sorry, sorry. Thought you were my pa. Just… having an argument online."

"Oh shit? Kate the keyboard warrior? What's up, what's going on?" - Vici quickly turned back towards Kate and quickly laid next to her to see what she was busy with.

"It's been a long conversation, there's a lot to keep track…" - Kate put down her phone and faced Victoria. "But he, okay. This guy said all cyborgs are evil and are abominations to God. Fucking why? Why would anyone ever think that? Does he not fucking realize people lose limbs in war and that they need bionics to not be fucking legless? HAS HE NOT HEARD THE SONGS AMPUTEES WRITE ABOUT THEIR LIVES? Or-or-or, or you know, people like you have sensitive ears and therefore need bionics to not die of earbleed every time there's a slightly louder than normal sound?" - Kate's tone and hand movements have been getting progressively more aggressive with time. "And when I tell him that, send him that one ancient song about a cyborg ninja who lost his legs and how all he feels is phantom pain, he just doesn't care. I mean, he says that the word of God is absolute and that he makes no exceptions. Like, what-what the fuck? \*How\* are people like that are allowed to walk the streets and not be chained and caged like the most animalistic of animals? W-w-w…" - Kate made one final exhausted exhale and shrugged quickly.

Vici's excitement about the conversation faded halfway through the rant, and she started giving the turned-off TV in the distance with half-emptiness, half-sadness. "Wow. There is \*definitely\* a problem here."

"Yes!" - Kate said so loudly that the auto-muter in Victoria's bionic ears was forced to activate for a moment to round up the volume spike. "I just don't understand how someone can look truth and logic in the eye and spit in them."

"No… Well, yea, I agree, but I feel like there's a different problem here. You see some stupid corpsebile online who argues a position that uses circular logic, high heels and stereotyping to justify their own prejudice, and you tell yourself, 'Target locked'. They become a target of your wrath. You gotta let it go sometimes, you know." - Victoria explained it with mildly audible sadness.

"Why is that a problem, though? I am a servant of the law, as nasty as it can be sometimes, it's… These people represent the prejudiced elements of the ages long gone and they need to be alienated for society to progress. It's shit like that which caused the segregation and the pogroms and the Holocaust and the Terkish genocide of Chinese ethnic minorities." - Kate spoke very fast, faster than usual. No, you read that last part right, she did not mean it the other way around.

"Yea, it's true, but that's not what I'm saying. You did this with the one who claimed muslims are born without a soul, the one who disagreed with you over duels being allowed again, the muslim who said you should be stoned to death for doing something other than cooking and cleaning, the gal who said her inferior female hormones made her stupid or whatever. How many more before it's enough? If these people are so ridiculous and stupid, why are you giving them your resources? Why are you taking them seriously? If these corpsebiles really are the kind of backwards savages we're raised to see as a negative example, why do they deserve your attention? I can see from the outside view how much energy you're wasting on them, and, is it really worth it? Are they worth it?" - Victoria faced Kate, trying to make the most reasonable and convincing expression she could muster. She felt like that required a light smile, but she also didn't feel like smiling.

Kate looked away for a second. "...I don't know… but if I won't do something about it, who will? All everyone does is ignore how many of these corpsebiles are in all corners of society and enable them and their behavior, and… I just don't know what I can do." - she admitted sadly.

"Not waste your energy trying to dissuade one, that's for sure. Have you ever successfully managed to convince your opponent in a political discussion to change their side to yours?" - a 5 second long silence dawned. Vici nodded. "Exactly." - she then laid back and faced the ceiling. "Truth is, I also don't know what we can do about this. Right now though, there's nothing. We're just cyanobacteria on a seashell we call Earth at the bottom of an ocean we call the universe. The only way to gain power here is to curbstomp others and their hopes and dreams. And that's what we're raised to do. As Starshards."

"I wanna believe you're wrong. I wanna hope there is something we can do about how shit everything is. I want a calmer world where draconian treatment isn't the norm and considering others' feelings is. And I can't give up striving for that goal." - Kate made a fist with her right hand and stared at it.

"It's your call. I already know we can't fully understand eachother's idealism and nihilism. Not much point arguing much about it." - Vici shrugged emotionlessly. It wasn't an opinion she consistently held regardless of mood: sometimes she was actually in the mood to do exactly that simply because it was fun.

"That we can agree on." - the same could be said about Kate. "I just realized something… You said, I quote, you gotta just let it go sometimes. Don't take this as a jeer \*verify wording\*, but does that mean our old teacher is off your hit list?"

Vici sighed. "I don't know. No, probably. You're right to point out the irony. But it doesn't bother me as much anymore. Everything is looking up for me, my life is improving, and my emotional state with it." - Victoria replied emptily.

Weapon usage:

Lasers: best choice against drones and unarmored missiles, too expensive against pretty much everything else

Plasma weapons: really expensive and impractical, reserved only for the rich

Railguns: great with supersoldier units and tanks and often paired with explosives, possible for infantry or civilian self defense but not cheap enough to be practical, also used for lighter AA protection

Flamethrowers: good for close quarters when collateral damage isn't a factor (very rare)

Modern ballistic pneumatic guns: police and civilian self defense

Anti materiel guns: best choice for infantry cannon fodder and standard androids

Gas weapons: used to drive up the costs of warfare for the enemy rather than as a genuine weapon

Flameblades: tons of mini flamethrowers on a durable blade. Designed for cyborg ninjas as an anti android measure

Counterparts of the military:

Fist of Liberty Branch (direct conventional warfare; encompasses ground forces, navy, AF, space warfare, drones and missiles)

Eye of Liberty Branch (external intelligence, spying, sabotage, assasinations, basically cia)

Mind of Liberty Branch (research, inventions, experiments, bioweapons and secretly nukes)
